An old red brick building with no windows and 5-story antenna sticking out from the center served as the communications building. The top of the antenna had a dim red light to serve as a warning to any low flying vehicles. The red light seemed to seep out into the fog. Private Olin punched in the four-digit door code to enter the exterior of the building. He wasn’t done, however, he had to go through two more doors with their own unique key codes—then down a labyrinth of narrow hallways and then through two more doors protected by a dial combination.

A heavy grey vault door was the last obstacle for him to overcome before reaching his work center. He picked up a 20-year-old analog phone and dialed the Base Defense Operation Center to gain entry. Once cleared, he entered the combo to the vault door and entered the communications facility— but he had to enter one more combination on a hidden keypad in 10 seconds, otherwise the facility alarm would go off. Olin could perform the procedures in his sleep. He entered the four numbers on the keypad, turning the red LED, green.

Done.

It only took him four minutes to enter work from the front door to the communications floor. He was getting good at his job. He turned on a relic of terminal machine on. The green monochrome monitor flickered on and gave him a “>” prompt. He entered a command signifying he was onsite and reporting for duty. It was now time for Olin to start work.

He flopped down on a comfortable office chair, kicked his feet up on his desk, and shut his eyes. The loud hum of all the communications racks were like white noise to him. There were 30 racks spread throughout the comm floor. Some were archaic Lilliputian analog multiplexors. Other racks consisted of multi-million dollar digital networking equipment with state of the art intrusion detection systems. Other racks contained sophisticated servers whose sole job was to analyze tons of data obtained by intercepting Blefuscudian networks.

Private Olin didn’t know how any of that shit worked. His job was to babysit the equipment and provide hands-on maintenance with heavy guidance of the agency on the other side of the phone. It happened only once to Olin since his assignment to Falcon Point. The agency—that Olin never heard about—called Olin’s phone up and had him hard reboot the SDP router. Once he did that, the agency hung up and never called back. Olin went back to his paperback book and didn’t think any more of it.

Olin jumped out of his seat when he heard a crashing sound coming from the server room. He heard the hum of a thousand internal equipment fans spinning—but that crash was way out of place. It sounded like a metal pipe falling on concrete.

“Anyone there?”

The equipment hum responded. Private Olin rose to his feet and hesitated about what to do next. It had to be his imagination. No one, except a select few knew the codes to enter the comm floor, and even then, they wouldn’t usually come to work until around nine. Olin walked through a wooden double door that led to the server room. The expansive room was dark except for the thousands of flickering lights that littered the front displays of rack-mounted equipment.

“Hello?”

Olin went for the light switch and flipped it on. One by one, the florescent lighting flickered on—row by row, the server racks were illuminated. The humming was loud; there might as well been a five ton truck idling in that room. Olin walked down the rows of racks and kept an eye out for anything suspicious. There was nothing. Just racks with cables spilling out onto the floor.

“I’m losing my mind.” Olin said to himself. He headed out of the server room and turned the lights off.

Another crashing sound. This time it sounded like a plastic printer exploding into a hundred pieces. Olin flipped the light on again—one by one the fluorescent lights turned back on illuminating one rack at a time as fast it took a traffic light to turn green. The room was still half-dark when Olin turned around, only to come face to face with the end of a pistol.

“Move and I’ll blow your fucking brains.” A man that Olin never met said. He had a thick Blefuscudian accent. “Turn around.”

Olin was surprised to see his trembling hands up in the air. In the past, Olin had fantasized what he would have done if he ever had a gun pointed at him. Just like in the movies, he pictured himself grappling the gun from the bad guy, only to shoot the villain in the stomach. Now that a real run with its black barrel pointed between his eyes was less than five inches from him… It took an incredible amount of willpower not to piss his pants right then. He wanted to speak but his throat locked up with a cold lump.

The Blefuscudian cocked his pistol and planted the end of the barrel against Olin’s forehead. “Are you fucking deaf, mate? Turn the fuck around.” The terrorist sneered.

The lights dimmed in the server room.

The hum of the equipment strained.

The gun in the terrorist’s hand trembled.

It pulled away from Olin’s forehead and retreated closer to the terrorist’s body. “What the fu—?” Still with trembling hands, the man’s wrist rotated. Brought to the man’s temple was the barrel end of the gun. Olin looked as surprised as the man did. “What are you doing?” The terrorist shouted.

Olin wasn’t doing anything! His breathing became rapid and irregular. He feared for the man as much as he feared for his own life. The man’s trigger finger quivered.

“What are you doing?” He shouted with glassy tear filled eyes. The man tried to move, but only managed to shake a millimeter. The man couldn’t run, nor move his arm. His finger squeezed the trigger. “What are you doing?” His voice was hoarse.

“I don’t know!” Olin was crying just as much.

The gun went off. The nine-millimeter bullet entered the man’s skull and tore a hole through his squishy pink brain. The exit wound exploded out of the side of the man’s head, pulling brain matter out. The wall adjacent to the terrorist splattered with gore and bits of brain. A mist of blood freckled Olin’s terrified face.

Olin screamed like a girl.

He called the military police a second later.
1511.title: Olin: A Soldier Story

15111.content:
“Sir, Private Olin reports as order, sir!” Olin saluted the Colonel seated behind a glossy oak table.

“At ease, son.” The Colonel returned a lazy salute. Olin went to parade rest. “You know why I called you here.”

“Sir, I believe it has something to do with the incident from last week, sir.” Olin shifted his eyes around the room. The Colonel served over two decades in the Lilliputian Army and it showed with the memorabilia around the office. There were plaques, shadow boxes, awards, dozens of coins on his desk, and other tacky gifts going-away gifts from previous assignments. Grey outdoor lighting seeped into the dim office. Olin sensed that there was someone else in the room. Someone in the shadows that wasn’t really trying to hide, but at the same time didn’t want to make himself known.

“Smart man.” The Colonel’s raspy voice said. “Do you find it odd, how you survived that pesky ordeal son?” His tone wasn’t of concern but almost accusatory.

“No, sir.”

“Now, why is that?”

“Sir, the private believes that the Blefuscudian was on a suicide mission.”

“Oh, cut the crap Olin.” The Colonel’s voice thundered. “You think one of those Blef-idiots would break into a top secret comm facility only to blow his brains out?”

Silence.

“Well, do you?” The Colonel jumped on his feet and leaned over his desk. “You want to explain to me, how you made a fucking Blefuscudian blow his goddamn brains out in my comm facility?” The volume of the Colonel’s voice was much scarier than the gun at Olin’s face.

“Sir, I don’t know how he—“

“I’ll throw you in the goddamn brig if you keep acting a fool. Don’t waste my fucking time. What did you do, to make that Blefuscudian prick shoot himself?” The Colonel picked up a remote from his desk and flipped on a wall mounted TV that Olin didn’t notice. It played a surveillance video taken from the server room right behind Olin’s shoulder. The tape recorded the look of terror on the Blefuscudian’s face. “Tell me, goddamnit.”

“That’s enough Johnny.” A disembodied voice said. Olin turned his head and saw what looked like businessman materialize from the dark shadows. “The boy clearly doesn’t know anything.” He held a small glass filled with honey colored whiskey. “And that shouldn’t be a problem.”

This mysterious man in a black suit was, as it appeared, higher in chain of command because the Colonel sat back down behind his desk, steam still coming off his baldhead.

“Private Olin,” the man in the suit was well into his fifties and it showed in his soft wavering voice, “why did you join the military.”

“I want to protect our people, sir.” It was the first bullshit reason Olin could come up with on the spot. The real reason he joined the military was that he didn’t have money for college and didn’t want to live with his parents; left with little options, he enlisted. Olin was smart enough to know that that’s not what the suit wanted to hear. Giving a shitty reason like protecting Lilliputian freedom should assuage him. “I believe in protecting freedom for all Lilliputians.”

“No you don’t.” The man in the suit took a sip of his drink. “Don’t lie to me son. It won’t work. You joined because you didn’t know what to do with your life. You didn’t want to work and try to college at the same time. You figured the military was an easy way out of your parent’s house.”

Olin wasn’t sure to fear the Colonel or this mysterious man more. It was as if he was reading his private life story. As if, he was in his mind.

“You’re going to be reassigned, Joel.” The suit took another drink. “You are going to be reassigned to a Gulliverian woman by the name of Jennifer Torrance. She’s got the same talent as you, but not nearly as powerful.”

What talent? I don’t have a talent. Olin thought.

“You do have a talent, and she’s going to help bring it out.” The old man’s cold blue eyes saw right through Olin. “After all, you want to protect all Lilliputians with your selfless service, isn’t that right?”

Olin nodded. He then looked at the Colonel who still had a bulldog look on his face.

“Good.” The old man in the black suit said. “You report in thirty minutes. I suggest you run off and pack up.”

“I—uhm just had—“ Olin stuttered.

“You had a question?”

“You had security cameras in the comm facility?”
15111.title: Orders are orders

choices: Jennifer trains Olin at her quarters
Jennifer trains Olin out in the field (Gulliveria)
Jennifer trains Olin out in the field (Brobdingnag)
151111.content:
Private Joel Olin had never ridden in a private hover car. His pilot wore a sharp suit and offered Olin a drink from the vehicle’s bar. Olin was still in his uniform with his green duffel bag by his scuffed up boots.

“We’ll be landing in a moment, sir.” The driver said through the vehicle’s intercom system.

“Oh, I’m not a ‘sir’, I’m just a Private.” Olin corrected him. “The term ‘Sir’ is only reserved for Officers.”

“That sounds interesting.”

The hover car landed without a bump onto a flat tarmac plane with no discerning features. The sky was clear blue and didn’t have that damned fog that Olin was accustomed to for the past year. As the vehicle landed, Olin plastered his face against the tinted window and looked out. He couldn’t see any trees, mountains, or anyone for that matter. A little dust cloud blew out from under the hover car as it came to a stop.

“We’re here.” The driver said. “Your contact will meet you here shortly. Be sure to grab a communications headset on your way out, private.”

Olin clicked open the door and then threw out his duffel bag. He grabbed a headset before hopping out. He closed the door, walked over to the driver side window and asked, “so I just wait here for my contact?”

The driver didn’t answer. The engine hum crescendoed as the vehicle levitated above Olin’s head before firing away like a rocket. Olin looked a little perplexed as he stared off into nothingness. He examined his headset before fitting it around his skull and powering it on. “Hello?” Only static answered him.

He waited there for another ten minutes. Nothing came over the headset; the tarmac plane remained vacant. Olin had some time to think about that morning when he killed the Blefuscudian terrorist. Just thinking about the fact that he killed someone seemed preposterous, let alone the notion that he committed such a heinous act with his mind.

Olin sat on his duffel bag and waited for another fifteen minutes. The heat bouncing off the tarmac from the sun was starting to get at him. He fanned his blouse from his chest for some relief. He used his forearm to wipe the sweat off his forehead. He kicked around a few pebbles as he fought the intense boredom he felt. Telekinesis. That’s what it’s called he thought. Does he really have such powers? Do such powers even exist? He focused on a small pebble in front of him. He pictured the rock moving away from him. Nothing happened. He shut his eyes and focused more on the pebble. He opened his eyes and squinted. He could almost feel the rock moving. Nothing.

Then something.

It bounced. Olin adjusted himself on his makeshift duffel bag seat. He focused more on the pebble and tried to make it move. It bounced up and down. Olin smiled in disbelief. He was doing it! He was moving an object with his mind.

But then he noticed the pebbles around the one he was focusing on were moving as well. In fact, all the pebbles were bouncing up in down. Shit, he was moving up and down in sync with the pebbles.

Olin looked around and saw someone in the distance, his or her form distorted like a mirage from the heat in the air. Olin got up to his feet and looked on with curiosity. The figure that stood several hundreds of feet away caused the rhythmic booms he felt under his feet.

“Hell—uhm, hello?” The figure came closer. Olin could now tell it was a woman wearing a Gulliverian military uniform. Unlike the Lilliputian uniform, the Gulliverian version had a digital urban colored pattern. The boots were green suede and didn’t require shining like the leather Lilliputian version. “I’m Private Olin with the 94th Signal Company. I’ve been assign—hey, watch out!”

Olin tried to jump out of the way but he was too slow. The green suede boot was upon him. Olin collapsed onto his back on the hot tarmac ground. The thick treads of the boot felt like rubbery concrete on his thin body.

“So, you’re the one everyone is talking about.” He heard a feminine voice through the headset. “The so-called Prodigy of Lilliput. You don’t look like much.”

More weight fell on top of Olin as the 430-foot tall Gulliverian female soldier rested her boot on top of him. His ankles bent to the side and found some relief between the thick boot tread. The soles of her boots made contact with his cheeks. Olin tried to push her off him, but it was like trying to bench press a skyscraper.

“Not much of a prodigy if I can step on you so easily. Shit, I can tell the boss I accidently stepped on you and that’ll be the end of that.” Jennifer stood in silence for a few moments before continuing. “I can’t believe you are replacing me. Not only that, but they expect me to train you? I’d rather you become a stain under my boots.”

Jennifer let more weight drop on her left foot. The Olin could feel his ribs on the verge of cracking, his ankles almost broken, and his breathing labored. The dusty underside of the sole felt like sandpaper on his cheeks. Darkness enveloped his sight, both due to bus-sized foot blocking the sun and due to lack of oxygen to his brain. Olin made one last Herculean effort to push Jennifer of him.

Something happened.

Jennifer’s left foot swung back like a reverse football kick. Her foot swung back with such a jolt that she lost her balance and fell to the ground. Her palms broke her fall, scraping them against the hot tarmac in the process. Olin was right below her shocked and angry face. A few locks of hair escaped from under her uniform hat and partially covered her face.

Jennifer composed herself and stood back up brushing her palms together. Olin tried to fill his lungs with air, but it felt like he was breathing through a straw. He got up to his feet and looked up at Jennifer. She had malice in her eyes as she stared down at the one-inch Lilliputian. She calculated her next words with care.

“You passed.” She said at last.

“What?” Olin coughed.

“Are you deaf? I said you passed. You’re not dead—after all.”

“What?” Olin said to himself as he looked around in a daze. “You almost killed me.”

“Don’t be so dramatic. What I did just now was part of the training.”

“What training? Stepping on me? You wanted to kill me! You didn’t know I could push you off.”

“But now I know you can push me off, otherwise you would be red stain on the street.” Jennifer adjusted her hair under her hat. “Well, grab your stuff and follow me.”

“Are you kidding me?” Olin slung his duffel bag over his shoulder. “I can’t keep up with you.” Despite his outburst, he tried to run after Jennifer. His lungs still ached as he breathed muggy air.

Jennifer did an about face, pebbles grinding under her boots as she did so. “You said you were a Private right?” She didn’t wait for an answer. “Well, I’m a goddamn Sergeant.” Her voice thundered, shaking the one-inch Lilliputian. “And when an NCO gives you a goddamn, lawful, order, you fucking obey, got it, Private?” She snarled.

Private Olin snapped to attention. “Understood, Sergeant Torrance.”

A glimmer of satisfaction appeared on Jennifer’s face as she re-composed herself. She spun around and continued walking. Olin sprinted with his heavy bag on his back, chasing his 430-foot tall Sergeant.
151111.title: Sarge

1511111.content:
For the longest time, the Gulliverian sergeant didn’t say anything. Which was fine with Olin, because he had to run to keep up with her tremendous strides and he couldn’t imagine trying to simultaneously engage in idle chitchat. Luckily, he was in excellent physical condition or otherwise he would have passed out already.

As he sprinted along, his mind tried to process all of the changes in his life. One minute he had just been another Lilliputian soldier, destined to lead a boring, routine life (assuming that a Brobdingnagian didn’t attack without warning; it was rare but it did happen from time to time. He had lost countless friends and fellow soldiers when some giant or giantess decided to destroy a major city). But now his life had been turned upside-down. He had some sort of weird powers, which was both frightening and exciting, and he had been assigned to this Gulliverian, which was just frightening. Olin could practically feel the disdain that she felt for him.

As if she read his mind, Jennifer stopped without warning. Olin didn’t have time to slow down and he crashed into her left boot, just below the huge rounded mass of her ankle. Lights flashed in front of his eyes as he fell over backward. As he scrambled to pull himself up, he saw the giantess reaching down for him, her massive fingers spread wide. It was one of those images that he had nightmares about, being grabbed by a giant person, and he cried out in panic.

Jennifer’s hand froze in its descent. It took him a minute to realize that it wasn’t his cry that had made her pause. Somehow, he was holding her hand back. Even now, he could see how her enormous palm and fingers trembled, pushing against an invisible barrier. The giantess’ mouth twisted in annoyance, quivering almost as much as her hand.

“Fine. I was going to carry you inside, but I don’t want to touch you, anyway,” she finally said, withdrawing her hand and standing back up. She turned and marched toward a Gulliverian-sized brick building that looked utterly cheerless. It was the sort of bleak architecture that Olin associated with government buildings. He watched as she unlocked the door and disappeared inside. The last thing that he wanted to do was follow her inside but he knew that he had no other choice. Sighing, Olin trudged toward the colossal door.

There was only one step in front of the door and he carefully climbed it, using the grooves in the concrete as foot and handholds. When he pulled himself up on the top of the step, he spotted Jennifer in the doorway, her arms crossed over her chest.

“God, you are so slow,” she remarked. Olin purposely didn’t meet her eyes as he walked past her inside.

“What, were you raised in a barn? Close the door behind you,” the giantess ordered. Olin looked over his shoulder at the door, which had to be the size of a skyscraper, and then glanced up at Jennifer’s scowling face.

“Sergeant Torrance, I’m unable to close a door that siz—“

“With your powers, Private!”

Olin focused his gaze on the door and concentrated. He inhaled deeply, clenched his fists, narrowed his eyes…and nothing happened. The door was impossibly huge and he couldn’t move it even a fraction of an inch. Sweat was beginning to bead on his forehead, a result of his intense concentration and the unnerving way that the giantess was glaring at him. Out of the corner of his eye, he saw her mammoth arm swing out and shove the door shut with a thunderous burst of noise.

“You. Are. Useless,” she growled, inserting a pause between each word. Her eyes had become mere slits, although he still saw enough of them to notice the changeable color of the irises. One minute they were storm-gray; the next, they were deep blue or vividly green, depending on how the light hit them. Olin had never seen eyes like hers and he stared at them until she frowned. Wisely, he averted his gaze and she began to unlock the door to her apartment.

The inside of her apartment wasn’t what he expected. For some reason, he imagined her living in more spartan quarters. But this apartment was lavishly decorated, the sort of chic style that he associated with home and garden magazines. Along the wall were rows of photos of various people, which he guessed were her family and friends.

Jennifer took off her hat and tossed it aside. Her hair was honey-colored and framed her face in a flattering way. She would have been a beautiful woman if she wasn’t so terrifying. Olin put down his duffel bag as she sat down on the couch, placing her hands on her knees and peering down at him.

“So how long have you have your powers, Private?” She asked him.

“Not for very long, Sergeant Torrance.”

One of her eyebrows quirked upward. “You mean, you just found out about them?”

“Yes, ma’am.”

Jennifer didn’t respond at first. She seemed to be considering something. Then she leaned forward, her huge face towering far above his.

“I’m going to train you, Private. Or kill you. One of the two,” she told him coldly.
1511111.title: Jennifer trains Olin at her quarters

15111111.content:
The Lilliputian certainly didn’t look very impressive. Jennifer had seen cockroaches that were larger than he was. Yet she could feel the psychic power that he was emitting; he was practically pulsating with it. Had his height equaled his power, he would have been fifty miles tall.

It frightened her, frankly.

Jennifer’s own powers were modest in comparison. She could turn on and off light-switches, levitate small objects, that sort of thing. It had been impressive when she was a child and could cause her teacups to float around her head. Her parents had been stupefied and amazed by her powers. Everyone had been, really. By the time she was an adult, she had been funneled into this clandestine program, its classification level above top secret. She had a gift and the brass intended to use it. The problem, however, was that her gift just wasn’t that astonishing.

So instead of being in the field, she was here, training some Lilliputian who was so small that she could have stepped on him without even knowing it. That knowledge chafed, like rubbing salt into an open wound.

Well, Jennifer had to live with it for now. She had been serious about what she said…either she would train the little punk or squash him and call it an accident. That was the thing about Lilliputians. They squished so easily.

Olin was watching her as she took off her boots and then peeled off the socks underneath, purposely tossing one of them in his direction. The tiny man cringed and raised his arms as the mass of fabric descended on him. Then it unexpectedly flew the other way, as if caught in a strong breeze. Jennifer considered this. He hadn’t been able to close the door, but he had stopped her foot and her hand and the sock. So his powers were triggered by fear and survival instincts, at least for now. She would have to remember that.

Jennifer stood back up and padded toward the kitchen, deliberately stepping close enough to Olin that he leapt back to avoid her foot as it crashed down. As much as she hated to admit it, she liked how she made him tremble. The spiteful part of her enjoyed the fact that she was so much larger than he was. It almost made up for the enormous discrepancy in their telekinetic abilities.

Almost.

She pulled out a skillet and then took some ground hamburger from the fridge. Olin remained in the living room, obviously reluctant to come toward her. To be honest, she was surprised that he hadn’t already fled for his life. He had courage, she’d give him that.

“The first thing you need to know about these powers is how to recognize and channel the telekinetic energy. Once you can recognize that energy, you can direct it,” Jennifer said to him, gesturing toward the package of hamburger. Using her own powers, she tore open the plastic and lifted up a glistening ball of meat. Olin’s mouth fell open as he watched.

The hamburger plopped into the skillet with a sharp sizzling sound.

“Usually I just eat Lilliputians for lunch,” Jennifer said as she located a spatula. She noticed how rapidly Olin’s face paled. “Holy shit, Private. I’m just joking.”

“Oh,” he replied weakly. Neither of them said anything while she finished cooking the hamburgers and then placed them on the kitchen table.

“Are you going to eat?” She asked as she slid onto one of the chairs. With extreme hesitance, Olin wandered into the kitchen toward her. When he reached the table, he glanced at the gargantuan table leg, then up at her. Of course he couldn’t climb it.

“Levitate yourself, Private. That’s an order,” Jennifer barked. The Lilliputian flinched at the sound of her voice. Maybe it was because of the fear that he felt, but as she looked on, he began to slowly lift himself off the ground. Jennifer sucked in her breath, astounded. She certainly couldn’t have done that.

Olin was almost to the top of the table when something happened…perhaps he doubted himself and the hold that he had over his powers faltered, but he suddenly started to plummet to the floor below. Jennifer reacted instantaneously, her hand shooting out to catch him. He bounced on her palm and then lay there, motionless. Concerned, Jennifer prodded at him with one finger.

“Are you okay, Private?”

Eventually, Olin stirred on her outstretched palm, looking dazed.

“I’m fine,” he mumbled and she grinned broadly.

“Good. Because your training’s not over yet.”
15111111.title: Continue

151111111.content:
Olin nearly screamed as Jennifer tilted her palm and he started plummeting. He dropped towards her burger, the soft bun breaking his fall. Breathing heavily, he just laid there, not sure how much of this he was going to be able to take. Ever since he discovered his powers he’d been terrified for his life. He wasn’t a very brave or tough man, for a solider he was kind of a wimp. He almost didn’t want to sit up, but he did and immediately regretted it.

“I’d move if I were you, private,” Jennifer remarked as she held the burger in front of her face and then opened wide. Olin nearly screamed when he saw the inside of her mouth. The gleaming teeth, twitching tongue and pink, wet walls, an entire squadron could fit inside her maw and he was heading right into the yawning cavern. She really was going to eat him!

Without thinking he flew backwards, away from the hungry mouth just before she bit down. He skid along the bun until he flew off and began falling again, luckily he managed to slow his decent enough that when he crashed he didn’t break anything. Shaken, he peered up as Jennifer chomped down on the spot he’d been lying on. If he’d been one-second slower she would have eaten him. She chewed her meal slowly, glancing down at the private with a bored expression. He had survived so far, but things were only going to get tougher and the more she saw him freak out the less convinced she was that he had what it took to be a good solider. If he didn’t learn to keep his cool he was going to be a red splotch on the sole of her boot.

“Hungry?” She asked before lowered the burger down to the table beside where he had landed. Looking at the house sized burger, Olin stomach growled, reminding him that he hadn’t eaten anything since yesterday. For so long he had only had to eat the tasteless army food provided for him in the mess hall. He couldn’t even remember the last time he had eaten something that didn’t taste like crap. Licking his lips he took a tentative step towards the meal, but stopped when Jennifer picked it back up and took another bite. Once more the burger was back on the table, but he was no longer as certain he wanted to get closer. If he tried to climb up and grab some hamburger meat she might lift the burger back up and take another bite, possibly eating him too. It might be safer to just wait for her to get finished and eat whatever crumbs are left.

“Well, aren’t you hungry? You're going to need all the energy you can get for training, so eat up.” Jennifer then grabbed the burger and took another bite as though to mock the Lilliputian man. Olin remained still, unwilling to risk his life to fill his belly. His refusal to follow orders got him an annoyed grunt from the sergeant. “Use your abilities to feed yourself. Rip a piece of my hamburger free for yourself before I finish or you’re not eating tonight, got it?”

Gulping, he nodded and focused on the burger after she took yet another bite. He had to move fast or she’d finish it. He was still trying to figure out how to use his abilities, most of the time he just used pure instinct and when he tried to focus his powers he often failed. Too bad there wasn’t an instruction manual for using psychic powers, because he could really use one right now. Or maybe it would help if his teacher wasn’t a sadistic, bitch that nearly killed him the first time they met. Of course he’d never say that out loud.

“Focus, focus,” he repeated as he tried to picture a piece of that hamburger meat tearing. He almost thought he had it, he could see a tiny piece coming loose, but then Jennifer grabbed the burger up and took another bite, ruining his concentration.

“Pathetic,” she complained with her mouth full. A few chewed up bits of hamburger flew from her mouth, splattering on the table. For one dark second, Olin considered picking up a chunk of drool covered meat and eating that instead, but quickly tossed that thought aside. That was too pathetic, even for him. He wasn’t some loser; he was just scared and confused by everything that had happened. He didn’t even know people had powers like his until he killed that terrorist.

“I’m not pathetic,” he told himself as he concentrated again as the burger came down. He grit his teeth and focused his mind on tearing a sizeable chunk out before it was pulled away. He wanted this, needed this. He was going to show the Gulliverian he wasn’t some bug that she could just step on, that he was a solider, a man!

With that thought a chunk of brown, cooked meat flew towards him so hard that it smacked him in the chest and knocked him over. Humiliated again, he still laughed as he hugged his meal to his chest. He had done it, just barely but he’d done it.

“Congratulations, you pulled off a trick I learned when I was ten, you should be very proud of yourself.”

Jennifer’s sarcastic response did nothing to dampen Olin’s spirits. It was just a small feat, but he had consciously done it, proving he could control his new powers. It gave him a momentary happiness and sense that maybe he could fully governor his abilities and be more then just a faceless Lilliputian private in an army of millions. He could make something of himself and show the sergeant that he was worth a damn.

When Olin bit into his hamburger it was the most delicious thing he had ever tasted. Maybe it was because he used his powers to get it or maybe it was because he’d been eating mess hall crap for over a year, whatever the reason was he savoured every bite.

“Don’t get cocky yet, private, we still have more training before we call it a night.” Jennifer had finished her burger and had cleaned up as her student finished his meal. For someone that had just learned about his gift he was learning fast, faster then she did at least. She tried not to feel jealous, remind herself how puny the private was, but when she saw him show her up she just wanted to flatten him and tell her superiors it was an accident. However, she was a professional and no matter how irritating it was that a man no bigger then a bug was replacing her she wouldn’t do anything to defy her orders, unless he was unfit for duty. The army didn’t need a coward or weakling. If he wasn’t capable of surviving her training then he didn’t deserve to live.
151111111.title: Earning Your Meal

choices: Jennifer takes Olin to her actual house in Gulliver lands
Jennifer takes Olin to Brobdingnag for more series training
1511111111.content:
Olin stands on the table watching Jennifer clean up their meal or as she would call it his latest test. He didn’t know what his training was going to be like, but if it was as nerve racking as the so called snatch and grab hamburger challenge he just went through, then he feared for the future. If their was one thing that Olin was sure of, it would be that, one Jennifer hated him, and two this so called training could cost him his life, for Jennifer already explained that she would either train him or kill him, with a smile on her face Olin presumed.
Olin lost in thought didn’t see the gigantic hand coming towards him. Jennifer grabbing Olin brings him up to her gigantic face. “Hop to private, being distracted could cost you your life!” Jennifer yells almost bursting Olin’s ear drums. “ I hope your ready private, the real training begins now.” Jennifer says tightening her grip to the point that Olin could hardly breath. Jennifer slowly brings the arm holding Olin back and then with Half of her strength, throws Olin towards the hard floor. “OW MY GOD!” Olin shouts as he falls towards certain death. Owen closes his eyes waiting for the end to come, but as he waited and waited for almost a minute, to his confusion he did not feel the hard impact of the floor nor did he feel pain or a threat to his life, instead he felt calm as if he was child in his mother’s embrace.
Owen opens his eyes and he sees the floor a few feet below him. Olin to his surprise was floating in the air but unlike before, when he needed to concentrate hard, this time it almost came so natural, that was what he would’ve said if he could keep it up, because as soon as Olin became aware of his power he fell to the ground with a hard thud. Jennifer was in complete shock, she expected that throw to kill the little insect but here he was still alive, still her problem. “Don’t rest yet maggot.” Jennifer said seething with anger as she stomps toward Olin with earth shaking steps. Olin sitting on the floor was at this moment terrified of this women, she was really trying to kill him. “Your training for today is to survive for 1 hour as I try to stomp the life out of you, think of this as cat and mouse.” Jennifer said lifting her right foot and wiggling her giant toes. “I would get up if I where you private.” Jennifer said slowly lowering her foot toward Olin who was still upon in complete shock.
Olin snapping out of his trance starts to realize his situation. Olin seeing a gigantic foot coming towards him puts his hands up and starts to scream, deep down Olin knew that his hands, and his meager strength would not be able to stop the building sized foot from squishing him, but he also knew it was to late to get up and run at this point, all he could do was face death once again. Jennifer meant every word that she said, she was going to kill him. Jennifer didn’t see Olin try to run away, and could only assume that he was to terrified to do so, even though she was going easy on the little man at first, by lowering her foot slowly, giving the maggot enough time to escape. “Pathetic” Jennifer thought as she lowered her foot all the way to the ground.
Jennifer, upon lowering her foot to the floor didn’t feel The tiny body of the insect that called itself Olin squish Beneath her gigantic feet. This confused her she new she had to have gotten him. Jennifer sees something move in the corner of her left eye, turning her head she sees Olin sitting on the floor looking at her in shock, fear, and confusion. Jennifer knew that once again the maggot used his powers subconsciously to protect himself, since the maggot was to afraid to move on his own, his powers acted on their own and moved him to a safe place, and did so, so fast she couldn’t see the act in progress. Jennifer hated to say or even think it but the maggots powers where amazing. “it’s not over yet private.” Jennifer says running towards him with the full intention to kill.
For a half an hour Jennifer has been trying to step on Olin and for half a hour Olin’s powers have protected him subconsciously, moving him away from danger. Owen at this point was able to find the strength to run, but compared to a person hundreds of feet tall running after him he didn’t make it far. Owen still terrified felt something else, in the pit of his chest, something he hadn't felt in a long time, anger. Olin was pretty much a laid back guy, he didn’t get angry, it was more like he couldn’t get angry because deep down he knew if he let his rage take over something bad was going to happen, his very instincts warned him of the danger, but right Olin didn’t care. He had been pushed around by this women for long enough and he had, had it. Olin stops running, and stands completely still.
Jennifer sees Olin stop his meager attempts to run away from her, and to her confusion stand completely still. Jennifer could sense something was wrong. The maggots powers were dangerously high and wild like a wild animal. The maggots body was glowing a azure blue color high was evident to her that Olin’s powers had fully manifested them self's. Jennifer stopped running toward the maggot and stared in disbelief at the one inch man that now she feared.
Olin slowly turns and faces Jennifer, with eyes glowing bright blue. Olin’s power starts to surround his body fueling him with ground breaking power, power he didn’t know how to use or control, but at this point he didn’t care, all Olin saw was the enemy, a target he wanted to destroy.
“Monster.” “What is that child” “get away from us you freak.” Olin started to hear voices echo throughout his head. The screams of women and their children started to invade his ears, and with a flash of pain that attacks his mind he sees a young boy, a boy in a white t- shirt and wearing black Nicky shorts. Olin soon realized that this young boy was him no older than 8 years old. “What is this?” Olin said grabbing his throbbing head. Olin saw his 8 year old self surrounded by women who looked to be school teachers and children who were to afraid to come near him. Some of these other children where beat up, and had scratches and bruises all over their body. Olin soon realized that this place was the elementary school he attended all those years ago, but what really shocked him was that the desks, books and pencils and papers started to float off the ground. Olin could tell that his 8 year old self was the cause of the phenomena and also that this child was pissed off, he was probably even more angry than Olin was right at this moment. “ don’t call me that.... I’m not a monster!!!!” 8 year old Olin screams. The vision starts to shift away from the school and Olin sees his 8 years old self being hugged by a man he did not recognize. “It okay to be angry my boy, but it’s not okay to hurt people because of that anger, promise me you will never let your anger control you.” The man said in a gentle voice. “Ok I promise.” The 8 year old Olin says “Hey dad, am I a monster?” The 8 year old Olin asks with tears in his eyes. The man looks at the young boy and smiles “No your a perfectly normal boy Olin.”
The vision ends and Olin comes to, Olin’s headache was gone and his rage had vanished as quickly as it had appeared. “What had happen, who was that man, why did I call him dad?” Olin had so many questions, but something snapped him out of his train of thought, Olin noticed something that took his breath away. The ground was ripped apart, the furniture was everywhere, the few windows the building had where smashed, the hole building was trashed and even the brick walls where filled with cracks and looked to be unstable, but what really shocked Olin was that Jennifer looked beat up, she looked to be surrounded in some kind of force field but she was still covered in scratches and her uniform was ripped in certain places, and her long hair was no longer tied neatly in a bun but hung loose past her shoulders.
“What have I done.”
1511111111.title: Continue

15111111112.content:
1 PERSON (Olin)

Three days had passed since I had lost control of my powers, or to be exact three days had passed since I almost destroyed Jennifer’s home. Ever since that day Jennifer has been avoiding me like the plague. Beside’s the usually names that she calls me when we cross each other’s paths like maggot, insect, privet, or little man, she barely takes even a little time out of her day to truly talk to me, “sorry if it’s so hard.” Jennifer would just ignore me and watch the news off of her flat screen TV, or read one of her books that she kept on a large wooden shelf, that dwarfed almost every Lilliputian structure ever made. We apparently were taking a little break when it came to training, I didn’t Blame her for not wanting to teach me, I almost killed her, if Jennifer hadn’t put up her force filled in time she would’ve died or been severely injured. Honestly though I think the thing that was most injured was her pried, I of course would never tell her this to her face, I still had a Intrust in living, but that would explain why her attitude seemed to get even worse when it came to me.

I truly was the bane to Jennifer’s existence, she made that clear when ever we were around each other. One time when Jennifer was sitting on her black leather couch watching TV, I wanted to watch TV with her but their was only one problem I was to small to sit down on the couch. I tried to climb to the top of the couch to sit down but their was not enough nooks and crannies to aid me in my climb. Despite my struggle Jennifer didn’t help me, instead she just looked down at me with a smug smile on her face. I didn’t dare use my powers to try to help me, I didn’t know how they would react, so long story short I wasn’t watching TV. Other times Jennifer would knock me over with her building sized feet when she passed me, like I didn’t already have enough trouble standing up from all the earthquakes Jennifer generated when she walked, and every meal I would have to use my powers to steal from Jennifer, so that I could eat, just like we did, the first day I moved in.

I spent most of my time in my room, which was Gulliverian size so I had a lot of space. I could only bring a few things from base camp so, yea I had a lot of space. It was currently night time so I was getting ready to dose off to sleep, I stopped my self when I heard talking in the room on the other side of my wall. The voice belonged to Jennifer, she sounded like she was on the phone with somebody, the question was who. I couldn’t make out much, the only words that I heard was that “he was not ready.” These words came from Jennifer who sounded in destress, if I didn’t know any better she might of been talking about me, no it couldn’t be Jennifer would never sound even a little bit worried about me, the man she despised. But if she was talking about me, then what was I not ready for.

The whole night I could not fall asleep. My life seemed to be falling apart. Fist my superiors send me to the boot camp from hell to train with satan herself, who could crush me with nothing but her baby toe, now they where making even more plains behind my back. If their was one thing I hated, it was when people decide how I’m going to live my life, and not even consult me about it at all. The more I thought about it the more pissed off I got.

“Bang” the door bust open and Jennifer starts walking in with booming foot steps. Jennifer wore nothing but skin tight white Nicky boxers that really showed off her smooth tan legs, and a white t-shirt left little to the imagination, her gigantic boobs pushing up against the white t-shirt outlined her huge nipples, and her thin belly was also displayed proofing that the T-shirt was to small for her. I couldn’t help but blush.

“Get your ass up maggot we need to talk.” Jennifer says bending down and forcefully picking me up.

While holding me in my fleshy prison Jennifer takes me to the kitchen counter and without warning drops me hard on its marble surface. I swear I will never get use to that, nor will I ever get use to how ruff Jennifer handles me. Jennifer to my surprise bends down until I am eye level with her gigantic face. She just stood their looking at me with her blue eyes that seemed to be able to peer into my soul. I just stared back at her feeling uncomfortable. It seemed to last a hour until finally she spoke.

“Their has been a change of plains insect.” Jennifer says standing up to her fool height and Turing around, giving me a fool view to her giant sized ass.

“Your training will not be held here, you will receive your training somewhere else. Jennifer said still having her back turned from me.

“What do you mean, now where am I supposed to go.” I said a little attitude evident in my voice.

Jennifer turns quickly turns around and stairs at me from high above. The wind generated from her simple action knocks me off my feet.

“Mind your tone when you talk to me insect.” Jennifer says with a voice that vibrates not only the marble counter that I’m on, but also my soul as well.

The feeling was back, the feeling of anger appeared in my chest. I was tired of this, tired of people deciding things for me.

“I have been watching my tone, no more, I’m tired of being your toy!” I yelled, not caring who I was talking to. I stood on my feet like a man and walked towards Jennifer. The kitchen counter only came up to Jennifer’s exposed belly so I wasn’t as intimidating as I believed.

Before I knew it Jennifer had snatched me up in her hand again. Only my hapless was visible so I couldn’t move, and if Jennifer kept on tightening her grip then soon I wouldn’t be able to breath ether. Jennifer slowly brings me up to her face, which wore a stern look, as her blue eyes where focused on me.

“You are stressed I understand that, but you will not talk to me like that again. Jennifer said in a low quit voice that made her seem even more scary than she already was. “Do I make my self clear?” She asked, her eyes not leaving my puny form, even for a second. I said nothing, because I was afraid and also because I could hardly breath.

“DO I MAKE MYSELF CLEAR!!!!” Jennifer yelled almost destroying my ear drums and blowing a whole windstorm in my face, ruffling up my hair and draining all of the rage out of my body. Her breath smelled like alcohol, which let me know that she had been drinking.

“Yes, yes I understand.” I said with a fearful tone. Apron hearing my answer Jennifer sets me back down on the kitchen counter, and bends down to meet my gaze.

“You will be going to
15111111112.title: New plan  (1 person Olin)

choices: Connie takes you to the military apartments  occupied by women
Connie takes you to the Brobdingnagian commander
151111111121.content:
1st PERSON (Olin)

Me and Jennifer had left our little home in the desert, I wasn’t happy to be moving so soon especially when I just moved in to that cheerless brick building, but Jennifer made it clear that my compliance wasn’t a factor. In all truth and honesty I think that Jennifer was more upset than me, I could tell seeing how she would glare at me, and how she gave off a pissed off vibe, that made it clear to all who saw her, Lilliputian and Gulliverian alike, to stay away from her. I felt bad I mean Jennifer’s place was a dump yes, but it was clear from the flat screen TV and the nice furniture that she had made a life their, and now she was going to leave that life to go to Brobdingnag with me.

Me and Jennifer got on a Gulliverian plane that was set to fly us to Brobdingnag. Jennifer and I were wearing our navy uniforms and even though she really didn’t want to Jennifer decided to carry me in her giant right hand, at least until we got to our seats. Jennifer didn’t hold me tightly like she usually would, in fact she had her right hand open so that I could sit comfortably in the middle of her palm. I couldn’t help but notice the details that made up Jennifer’s hand. I could feel how rough Jennifer’s hands was as I rubbed my hand up against hers, I felt the ridges that made up her finger prints and was amazed how small I was compared to her, and not just her but everyone and everything. I was in Gulliverian territory, in all my life I have never seen so many giant people, and now I am going to Brobdingnag were the people are even more gigantic.

“What are you doing maggot?” Jennifer asked as she looked down at me. I immediately stopped rubbing her hand.

“Nothing.” I said with wide eyes.

Upon arriving at our seats Jennifer drops me on the seat closes to the window. The fall wasn’t that long but upon contact with the cushion I went tumbling. The back of the seat stopped my fall. I stood on my feet and looked at Jennifer who sat down in the chair next to me. Jennifer was looking down on me with a smug smile on her face.

“Thanks.” I said sarcastically, which caused Jennifer to giggle.

I sat down in a chair that was hundreds of times bigger than me. Could this be anymore ridiculous.

1st PERSON (Jennifer)

I hated this, I hated him. Ever since this insect, came into my life, everything seemed to turn bad to worse. Ever since the merging of the armed forces of the three great powers, which were Brobdingnag, Gulliveria, and Lilliput I had lived a life of simplicity. My Powers made me a valuable asset to my people, and of course a secret weapon to the Lilliputians. My powers gave me the ability to read the minds of my targets, with my powers I defended the treaty of the three great powers from all those who sought to do it harm, the treaty that was named the Trinity Accords. These accords embodied peace between the three races, peace for the world. It was my job to protect this peace with my powers, but now everything had changed. The powers that I had pride in, where nothing compared to this insect, that only made me hate him more. As I sat in my seat I couldn’t help but think back to that day when this insect had almost killed me. I had to put up a force field to protect myself, doing so took a lot out of me. It took me days to regain my full strength. How, how could this 1 inch man be so powerful, a man who was smaller than my pinky, who I could swallow whole, I just couldn’t understand it.

“Um Jennifer?”

I looked down at the little maggot who dared to say my name so familiarly.

“What do you want.” I said with a stern tone that caused the little man to flinch ever so slightly.

“ I, I just wanted to say sorry.” The maggot said with a soft tone as he looked down at his cries crossed legs.

“Sorry for what, being a pain in my ass.” I said looking away from the little maggot.

“That, and for making you leave your home for me.”

I couldn't help but stair at the maggot with a gentler look. What was with this guy, I had treated him like dirt and here he was apologizing to me.

“Don’t worry about it Olin, I’m just doing what a solider must, I’m just doing my duty.” I said reverting my gaze once again.

Why was I being such a jerk to this guy. I had never treated anyone with such disdain like I treated Olin. I didn’t hate Lilliputian’s, in fact I treated them like they were my equals, in my line of work I was around Lilliputians a lot so why, was it this Lilliputian that brought out the worst in me. I kind of felt guilty, I had not acted like a Professional solider. I had to be stern but I didn’t have to act like a jerk. I wanted to apologize to him but when it came to feelings, I was not a expert.

1st PERSON (Olin)

Did I hear right, did she just call me Olin, not maggot, or insect, I mean Jennifer rarely called me solider, but calling me by my name, mind blown. Maybe this was proof that our relationship was growing. I thought about our so called relationship, throughout the entire flight.

It took about 8 hours for us to reach Brobdingnag. Jennifer picked me up, gently which once again surprised me and we made our way off the plane. While i sat in Jennifer’s hand I looked at my surroundings with wide eyes. I thought Jennifer was big but compared to a Brobdingnagian she was nothing. Brobdingnagian after Brobdingnagian walked by Jennifer creating seismic earthquakes with their footsteps. Earthquakes that shook me and Jennifer to our core. As a Brobdingnagian walked by they created raging winds that would have killed me if Jennifer hadn’t shielded me with her hand. I didn’t know she cared.

Jennifer recovered our luggage and with me in her hands walked out of the airport. I couldn’t help but notice that Jennifer was looking for something or someone as she walked out the airport.

“What are you looking for Jennifer?” I asked.

“The military was suppose to send someone to pick us up. A old friend of mine you could say.” Jennifer said.

“Oh their she is.” Jennifer said with a smile on her face.

Jennifer walked toward a unknown destination. I assumed that she had found her old friend. After a few minutes had passed she had finally stopped walking. I couldn’t recognize anything Jennifer was moving to fast and everything was to big for my sense to perceive.

“Connie down here!” Jennifer shouted.

I looked at Jennifer who was looking up at something else. Connie? who’s Connie? All of a sudden my body was struck with a huge amount of G-force that pined me to the ground which was Jennifer’s hand. The G-force soon vanished and I was able to stand on my own two feet again.

“What was that?!” I shouted with a little bit of Panic in my voice.

“It’s good to see you again, my friend.” Jennifer said with a smile totally ignoring me.

Jennifer’s hand starts to shake and thunder echoes across the sky, which was weird seeing, how their were no clouds in the sky.

“Yea I got him he’s right here on my hand.” Jennifer says to a unknown person.

Who the hell was she talking to? I thought, then I notices something that caught my attention. Someone was watching me. I turned around and saw something that took my breath away, a 300 foot blue eye was staring right at me.

“Jesus Christ!!!!!!”
151111111121.title: Brobdingnagian

1511111111212.content:
(Olin 1st person)

Have you ever wondered what you would do if you stood before god, what you would say, I ask because I was standing right in front of one and I needed ideas. I standing in front of 300 foot giant blue eye, is to afraid to move even a inch. The eye seemed to be staring right at me with its intense gaze, a gaze that was to overwhelming for me to comprehend. The eye not only dwarfed me but also completely dwarfed Jennifer as well. Well ma I was no longer in Kansas.

“I think you scared him.” Jennifer says giggling, creating small vibrations that lightly shook me back and forth.

I turn to Jennifer and see her staring at me with a smile on her face. It was always good to see that Jennifer found pleasure in my torment. I soon realize while looking at Jennifer, that on top of her head she was wearing a headset, which explained how she was able to converse with a Brobdingnagian. I remembered that I had also packed a headset in my luggage, and with great hast took it out and put on so that I could hear Connie’s voice.

“OH NO I HOPE I DIDN'T SCARE THE LITTLE GUY.”

The voice was powerful and filled with enough force to shatter my body a thousand times over, this was Connie’s voice. To think that a few days ago I honestly thought that Jennifer was the strongest being on the planet, compared to this girl Jennifer was nothing but a bug, and me, less than dust.

“I CANT SEE HIM, IS HE ALRIGHT?” Connie asks sounding generally concerned. Which was a good change of pace, from the usual hate and wrath that I get from Jennifer.

“He’s fine, I bet he’s just scared of your gigantic size.” Jennifer says with another giggle.

“OH IM NOT THAT BIG AM I.” Connie asked.

“Connie your ginormous, especially to a Lilliputian.” Jennifer said.

Jennifer looks at me with a stone cold look that warned me that she was about to give me a nonnegotiable order.

“Hurry up and introduce your self soldier.” Jennifer demands.

I immediately stand up straight and salute the gigantic 300ft eye right in front of me.

“Private Olin Kane reporting for duty ma’am.” I say into my headset.

“OH I CAN HEAR YOU.” Connie says in a surprise voice.

“ITS NICE TO MEET YOU PRIVATE OLIN, IM PRIVATE FIRST CLASS CONNIE PIERCE.”

Connie Pierce so that’s her name. I thought as I continue to look into her gigantic blue eye. She was a Private First Class the same as Jennifer, that meant that she was one rank higher than me.

“Connie what are you doing?” Jennifer asks above me.

“SALUTING OF COURSE, TO SHOW RESPECT.” Connie says

“You know he can’t see you saluting right, he’s to small to make out your entire eye let alone your entire face.” Jennifer said, not trying to spare my feelings even a little bit.

“OH RIGHT, OLIN IS THIS BETTER?” Connie asks.

What did she mean? I thought not sure as to what she was talking about. Then I notice something. My surroundings were moving, slowly but surely. I soon realized what Connie was doing she was moving her hand away from her face. Connie’s massive eye began to shrink as I grew further and further away from it. I soon was able to make out two eyes, then a nose, a mouth, and soon her whole entire moon sized face, with her hand at the top of her hand performing the biggest salute I had ever seen.

“Yea that’s much better.” I said looking amazed.

“GLAD YOU THINK SO, WELL WE AHOULD GET GOING, CAPTAIN JANE WANTS TO HAVE A WORD WITH THE BOTH OF YOU TWO.” Connie said.

The ground beneath my feet began to abruptly shake. It shook with such a ferocity that I could no longer stand on my own two feet. I somehow knew from instinct that this earthquake was not coming from Connie. I look behind me, and notice Jennifer, who had a scared look on her face. Sweat big enough to soak me was running down her forehead, Jennifer looked like she had seen the scariest monster in the world. She seems to be terrified.

“Do we have to see the captain right now?” Jennifer asked with a shaky voice.

“SORRY JENNIFER SHE ORDERED ME TO BRING YOU BOTH TO HER AS SOON AS YOU GOT OFF THE PLANE.” Connie said with a sympathetic smile.

I continued to look at Jennifer who continued to wear a look of worry, who in the world was this captain that had Jennifer terrified of her very name. Usually this would have been the greatest day in my life, seeing Jennifer scared shitless, by someone more powerful than her, but I didn’t feel happy, because I had to meet this so called captain as well. I could barley survive Jennifer who was a Gulliverian, I doubted that I could survive a Brobdingnagian, who made Jennifer look like a scared child.

It didn’t take us long to reach Brobdingnagian HQ, which was the biggest building I had ever seen. Brobdingnagian HQ rested in the middle of Brobdingnag, Connie told me that it was 50 floors high, and also that their where even bigger buildings in Brobdingnagian. I had to admit it, Brobdingnag was a outstanding place, even the smallest building totally dwarfed our Tallest Lilliputian skyscraper by miles, the same could be said for the people as well who were bigger than our tallest mountains.

Connie brings Jennifer and I inside the humongous building. Connie gets inside a elevator that brings us to the top floor of the whole building. Apparently the captains office was on the highest floor. I simply sat in the palm of Jennifer’s mile long hand, who sat in the palm of Connie’s mile long hand. I took a glance at Jennifer and noticed that she was still sweating, still scared. I wanted to help her but I was scared as well.

Soon Connie stood in front of a wooden door thousands of miles long. Connie knocks on the door three times, creating a deafening sound that echoes through the air.

“COME IN.”

A loud voice Emanates from behind the door. Connie without hesitation opens the door, revealing a office miles and miles long. The office was fairly clean, and smells rather nice. The Captains office had white walls with a few pictures decorated on each wall. In the middle of the room was a tall glass table with 4 chairs surrounding it, and at the back of the office was a mile long wooden desk with a women sitting on top of it with her legs crossed. The wall behind the women wasn’t a wall at all but a long glass window, revealing the night city in all its glory.

I looked at the gigantic women, and I could tell without a doubt this was captain Jane. Captain Jane had brown hair which was held together by a brown hair clip on top of her head, she had white skin, and on her right cheek rested a scare 100s of miles long, from my perspective, but to her it seemed to only be a few inches, so not a big deal. Captain Jane wore a long sleeved military button down shirt with the sleeves rolled up to her elbows, she also wore military terrain pants, which had a lot of pockets, but it went well with her military boots. Captain Jane radiated leadership and confidents. Captan Jane also wore a headset on top of her head.

Captain Jane looked right at Connie, Jennifer, and I with a smile on her face. Her brown eyes seemed to be staring at me with great intensity. But that couldn’t be possible I was to small to be spotted that far away.

“WELCOME TO BROBDINGNAG.”

(Author notes)

I hope you liked the story, their was not much action in this story but I promise their will be action soon. Please help me continue this story can’t do it by myself. Thanks again for reading

By the Prophet
1511111111212.title: Connie takes you to the Brobdingnagian commander

choices: Time for training on a Brobdingnagian level
Continue to Train with Jennifer ( she’s pissed)
15111111112121.content:
(Olin 1st person)

Their I was surrounded by three titanic women, Jennifer who was a Gulliverian, Connie who was a colossal Brobdingnagian, and captain Jane herself, who was also a Brobdingnagian, but a Brobdingnagian that made Connie and Jennifer utterly terrified, and these were women who totally had dwarfed me in size, and power. As I sat in Jennifer’s hand, who in turn sat in Connie’s hand, I couldn’t help but wonder what kind of women was Captain Jennifer. Gazing upon the captains mile high form, I couldn’t help but think that the captain was a very beautiful women, just like Jennifer, and Connie, but I still didn’t let my guard down, because even a beautiful rose had thorns, and a Brobdingnagians thorns would utterly impale me.

“PLEASE HAVE A SEAT.” Captain Jane said as she walked over to the glass table with earth shaking footsteps and seats in one of the monolithic chairs.

My surroundings once again started to become blurry as Connie moved towards the glass table, and without warning Jennifer’s hand started to wobble and shake, as Connie sat down at the glass table. I soon realized that Jennifer had fallen down, and that was the cause for the sudden quakes that kept me on my ass.

Connie puts Jennifer down on the table, and Jennifer puts me down on the glass table as well. In my eyes the glass table went on for miles and miles, I could barley see the edge. Looking forward a few hundred miles away I saw captain jane who’s upper body towered over me with great ease. Her eyes where really fixed on my location, could she really see me? I looked behind me to see Jennifer who’s right foot was a few inches away from me. She wasn’t looking at me, she was looking at captain Jane with nothing but fear. Right above Jennifer I saw the towering form of Connie who cast both me and jennifer into her shadow. The table came up to both Connie’s and captain Jennifers stomachs, so I got a good view of both of their breasts that were their own mountain ranges.

“JENNIFER, ITS SO GOOD TO SEE YOU AGAIN LITTLE ONE.” Captain Jane said looking at Jennifer with a giant smile on her face.

I could see her teeth, teeth that were bigger than the whole Lilliputian base.

“It’s g, good to see you again Captain Jane.” Jennifer stuttered like she was a lost for words.

Looking at Jennifer I could tell that she was embarrassed, especially when she shot me a look that pretty much said “if you ever mention this to anyone, I’ll devour you whole.” When me and Jennifer lived together alone I had got that look a lot.

(Jennifer 1st person)

This was the last situation I wanted to be in, being surrounded by Brobdingnagian. People who dwarfed me entirely. It was in this kind of situation that aloud me to understand how a Lilliputian felt when they came face to face with a Gulliverian. I looked down at Olin and wondered how did these people, who were gigantic to me, look to someone so small like him. I would have to ask him later, after I leave the presence of the devil herself.

“SO LITTLE ONE, HOW HAVE YOU BEEN?” Captain Jane says as she looks down at me with a amused smirk.

I hated how she called me little one, so demeaning, captain Jane always knew how much I hated that nickname, that’s why she always made sure to call me, little one, when ever she got the chance.

“I’ve been well.” I said with a little irritation in my voice, looking away feeling embarrassed.

“How have you been captain?” I ask, even though I really didn’t care.

“OH IVE BEEN WELL, ITS BEEN GETTING BUSY OVER HERE, BUT STILL NOTHING I CANT TAKE CARE OF.” Captain Jane says still looking at me with that smirk on her face.

“Well that’s just great.” I say with a fake smile.

“AND YOU MUST BE PRIVATE OLIN KANE.” Captain Jane said turning her attention away from me and to Olin.

(Olin 1st person)

Oh great now the gigantic goddess was talking to me directly. That was the last thing I wanted. From captain janes conversation with Jennifer I could tell that she was a playful type of person. But what did that mean when it came to me.

“Yes ma’am private Olin Kane at your service.” I said trying to prevent my voice from cracking.

“IT IS A PLEASURE TO MEET YOU PRIVOT.” captain Jane says with a sexy voice that almost turned me on.

“WELL IF YOU HAVE NOT HEARD YET MY NAME IS JANE, JANE CRAWFORD, BUT EVERYONE JUST CALLS ME CAPTION JANE.” Captain Jane says in a ground shaking voice.

“It is a pleasure to meet you ma’am.” I said.

“IF THEIR IS ONE THING I LOVE IS A TINY MAN WITH MANNERS.” Captain Jane says with a little moan.

“Uh thank you ma’am. I said blushing a little bit.

I could feel the table start to vibrate, turning around I see Jennifer staring at me with a irritated look, tapping her giant foot with her arms crossed. Was she pissed with me. Looking passed Jennifer I see the mile long face of Connie with the same irritated look on her face, as she brought her moon sized face closer to the table. Connie’s face filled up my whole entire sky, I could feel her breath blow through my hair as she breathed. What was her problem now.

“WELL I GOT TO SAY, IT IS SURPRISING TO SEE SOMEONE ELSE WITH THE SAME POWER AS JENNIFER, ESPECIALLY SOME ONE WHO IS AS HANDSOME AS YOU.” Captain Jane says leaning closer to me.

“You can see me?” I asked

“I thought I would look like, less than a speck of dust to someone as big as you guys. I stayed a little surprised.

“OH YOU DO, BUT YOU LILLIPUTIAN SUPERIORS SENT OVER A PICTURE OF YOU A FEW DAYS AGO.” Captain Jane said showing me a picture of myself.

I had to say the picture that captain Jane showed me of myself, was the biggest picture of myself I had ever seen.

“I GOT TO SAY YOU ARE A HANDSOME MAN, DON’T YOU AGREE CONNIE?” captain Jane asked looking towards Connie.

All eyes including mine, where on Connie. I could see Connie look at captain Jane with a little surprise, than she fixed her titanic eyes in me. Her white skin soon turned red.

“I,I,I THINK THAT HE IS QUITE A HANDSOME MAN.” Connie says to my surprise.

Connie soon turns her mile long face away from my direction. Was she embarrassed? Once again I glance at Jennifer, damn she looked more pissed off than before. The hell was her problem.

“Well thank you captain Jane, and you to Connie, but I’m not that handsome.” I say into my headset rubbing my head.

“OH DON’T BE SO MODEST.” Captain Jane says with a little laugh that shakes the table.

“And when it comes to my powers, I was surprise to see that i had powers as well, powers a lot stronger than Jennifer’s.” I said looking at Jennifer who gasped at my little comment.

“Why you little!” Jennifer says stomping towards me, I could practically smell the anger coming off of her, and her booming foots steps always made it impossible for me to stand up and run away.

“JENNIFER CALM DOWN, DON’T HURT THE LITTLE GUY.” Captain Jane says, Imprisoning Jennifer in a mile long fleshy prison, that was her hand. Captain Jane was also laughing at my commit.

“OH I LIKE THE SPONK IN THIS ONE.” Captain Jane said in between laughs

“WELL LITTLE MAN HOU WILL BE ABLE TO PROVE YOURSELF DURING TRAINING, I FOR ONE HOPE THAT YOU SURVIVE THE EXPERIENCE.” Captain Jane said with another gigantic smile, as she still held Jennifer in her right hand.

Jennifer was staring at me with a angered look, the kind of look that told me that she wanted to take me apart. I let out a little sigh because I knew I was going to have to deal with her later.

So this was what I was dealing with, Captain sexy Jane the Brobdingnagian who seemed to love to mess with me, Jennifer the Gulliverian who wanted to kill me and Connie the other Brobdingnagian who was also irritated at me for some reason. I swear the giant women in my life.

At the end of the day, I don’t think I’ll ever figure out the mystery’s of giant women. 😉
15111111112121.title: Mystery’s of giant women

151111111121211.content:
(Olin 1st person)

The meeting soon ended between me and the three gigantic women who completely toward over me with complete ease. As soon as we where done talking to Captain Jane Connie picked both me and Jennifer up in her mile long hand and walked out of Captain Janes office that seems to stretch all the way to infinity. Before Connie completely walked out the door, I turned and looked at Captain Jane, who in turn was looking at me with a smile on her moon sized face, and as a final farewell gave me a seductive wave. It never ceased to be amazing, how she could see my minuscule form from such a distance.

“What a women.” I said with a smile.

“You say something private?”

I break away from my train of thought and look up at Jennifer, who’s hand I was currently in right now. Jennifer’s eyes where like daggers, daggers that pierced my very flesh as she stared at me. I, having lived with Jennifer for quite a while could tell that she was pissed at me. I was going to get it tonight.

“So you little bastard you think you can beat me do ya.” Jennifer said closing me in a fleshy grip that kept on getting tighter and tighter.

“I’ll keep that in mind for our next training session.” Jennifer said bringing me up to her gigantic face as she smiled at me with threatening eyes.

“OK CONNIE GO EASY ON THE LITTLE GUY.” Connie says from up above.

“HES GOING TO NEED ALL OF HIS ENERGY FOR THE TRAINING THAT AWAITS HIM.”

I didn’t like the sound of that.

Jennifer soon opens her hand back up, allowing me to breath again as I was on all fours gasping for air.

“W, what training what am I going to do?” I asked feeling a little bit worried as I looked at Jennifer’s face from up above.

Jennifer stairs down at me and lets out a little giggle that vibrates the very landscape which was her hand. Whenever Jennifer was happy it was never good for me.

“Lets just say that the training you are going to go through here is nothing compared to the training you are going to experience here.” Jennifer says with a smile that showed her building sized teeth.

A chill ran up my spine as both Jennifer and Connie where giggling with so much earthshaking glee.

“WELL I WONT LIE TO YOU OLIN THE TRAINING WILL BE HARD, BUT IF IT MAKES YOU FEEL ANY BETTER YOU WILL BE LIVING WITH GIGANTIC WOMEN WHILE YOU ARE HERE TRAINING.” Connie says.

“Come again?” I ask not sure I heard what I heard.

“YOU WILL BE LIVING WITH THE OTHER BROBDINGNAGIAN WOMEN, SICE YOU ARE JENNIFERS RESPONSIBILITY YOU WILL HAVE TI BE WITH HER AT ALL TIMES WHILE YOU ARE HERE.” Connie says as she lifted both me and Jennifer towards her mountain dwarfing blue eye, which once again completely toward over me.

“Oh please don’t remind me.” Jennifer said looking down at me.

Upon hearing Connie’s words I couldn’t help but think that maybe, being here wouldn’t be to bad.

Connie soon walks out of Brobdingnagian headquarters and gets in her black Honda Accord, and after putting me and Jennifer on the passenger seat, drives towards the Brobdingnagian women barracks.

Connie seemingly drove for around 4 hours and by the time we made it towards our destination it was 11:30 pm at night, and I was tired 😓.

While sitting in Jennifer’s right hand I feel the car stop. I turn towards my left to see Connie’s gigantic form exit the car. This was the first time I had seen Connie in all of her glory. Connie was wearing black business pants and a white short sleeve blouse and miles and miles above I could just make out her whole entire face instead of small sections. She truly was a goddess and as she exited the car raging winds hit both me and Jennifer in our face.

Connie upon exiting the car picks bot me and Jennifer up carefully. I looked around our surroundings. It looked like we were in the middle of a large lush jungle, were the trees where bigger than any Lilliputian and Gulliverian skyscraper. In the middle of this large forest stood the Brobdingnagian barracks, which looked almost like summer camp bunks.

“Is this really the women Brobdingnagian barracks?” I asked. Honestly I would’ve preferred Jennifer’s rundown building home.

“I KNOW ITS NOT MUCH BUT THIS WHOLE ENTIRE OPERATION IS TOP SECRET SO IT HAS TO BE IN A AREA UNKNOWN TO ALMOST EVERYONE EXECPT A SELECT FEW.” Connie says from above.

“Oh stop complaining Pivot you will get what you get and like it.” Jennifer said looking at me with irritation in her voice.

“NOW IF YOU DON’T MIND HOW ABOUT YOU MEET THE OTHER WOMEN HERE.” Connie said as she looked down at both me and Jennifer with a mile Long smile in her face.

“SOLDIERS FALL IN!” Connie yells, forcing me to cover my ears. I wasn’t the only one as Jennifer quickly covers both her ears, dropping me 100s of feet to the ground which was Connie’s hand.

I land on The fleshly surface which was Connie’s hand still grasping both of my ears.

Soon my ears stop ringing, standing in both of my feet I look up to see Jennifer bend down to slowly and carefully pick me up.

“Dang Connie can you please give us a warning before you yell.” Jennifer says holding me in her hand. An

“OH SORRY YOU GUYS I FORGOT HOW POWERFUL MY VOICE WAS.” Connie says from above.

The ground soon began to shake with a great fury. Soon the front door of the barracks flew open and 10 gigantic girls ran out and lined up miles away from Connie and me and Jennifer.

“OLIN I WOULD LIKE YOU TO MEET THE BROBDINGNAGIAN SECRET OPERATIONS PSI-LOCK.”

Right here, right now was the beginning of my training, training on a Brobdingnagian level, training to join Psi-lock.

“Let’s begin.”
151111111121211.title: Time for training on a Brobdingnagian level

1511111111212111.content:
(Olin 1st person)

I laid on a pillow a thousand times to big for me, on a bed that stretched out like a never ending landscape. The covers to the bed where unruffled, I wouldn’t need to use them seeing as to how they where to big for someone as small as me, as well as to heavy, all I had to cover my whole entire body was a ripped piece of a napkin that in truth was also to big for me. This was one of the things I would have to get use to when it came to living with towering giants. I turn my head to the right to see the towering figure of Jennifer laying right next to me on the pillow with her eyes closed. It in many ways was amazing to see that the pillow dwarfed even her with its huge size, but in the end it all made me realize how small I was, how hopelessly small I was to a Gulliverian, as well as a Brobdingnagian.

Training would be tomorrow so both Connie and Jennifer advised that I got some much needed sleep, especially after such a hectic day, but it didn’t matter how much I tried I just couldn’t fall asleep, and soon my mind drifted to what it always drifted to when I was alone. The vision that I had when I first lost control of my powers. The vision of the strange man that I saw, the man that the younger version of me called father, as well as the incident at my old preschool, the incident that involved flying books and desks. I couldn’t help but wonder was their another time in my life that I had activated my powers and if their was why didn’t I remember it? That man couldn’t really be my father could he, no I have a father as well as a loving mother, therefore in the end I came to the conclusion that I was just seeing things, and yet I still couldn’t shake the feeling that, that so called vision was true.

I soon purged my mind of the mysterious vision and soon begin to think about the events that transpired as soon as I came to the headquarters of the top secret team call Psi-lock

(Flashback)

I stood in the middle of Jennifer’s giant sized palm who in turn stood in the middle of Connie’s giant sized palm. Both me and Jennifer looked at the ten monolithic women who stood miles and miles away from our location, but I had got the impression that I was the only one in complete shock as well as terroir. You might be asking how could I tell, well Looking up above I could see that Jennifer’s face was completely calm with out even a little bit of fear, heck she even seemed to smile a little bit as she saw the gigantic girls who were all standing in a straight line. It was already common knowledge to me that This wasn’t Jennifer’s first time in Brobdingnagia, in fact if I new anything about Jennifer’s work than this wasn’t even her second time in Brondingnagia, but even if that were the case I still couldn’t understand how she could be so calm especially when it came to such gigantic beings. I soon turn my attention back to the living goddesses and I see almost everyone smiling back at Jennifer as if she were a old friend, except one of the gigantic women that stood at the very end of the line.
