The giantess had long black hair that cascaded behind her back and she had pure white skin that seemed to glisten in the moon light. Even thousands of feet tall she along with every women in line was beautiful but unlike the others I felt danger emanating from that girl in particular.

“AT EASE GIRLS.” Connie says from above, and as soon as she does the Towering girls become more relaxed.

I BELIEVE YOU ALL REMEMBER SERGEANT TOLERANCE.” Connie says with a voice impossible for any Lilliputian to ignore.

““““YES MA’AM!!!!!!!”””” All the girls shout with such furry that I am blown off my feet. I once again found that my ear where ringing from the loud thundering Booms that came from the Brobdingnagian women’s earth shattering voices. Looking up at Jennifer I could see that she wasn’t effected as much as she was when Connie shouted since this time she wasn’t that Close to the giant women but for a brief second I did see her wince in pain. I place my arm around Jennifer’s thumb and carefully return to my feet rubbing my ears to ease the pain. Now to get one thing straight I really couldn’t understand what the Brobdingnagian women where saying, Lilliputians could only barley understand Gulliverians without a headset, Brobdingnagians on the other hand are another larger story. The only way a Brobdingnagian could understand a Lilliputian and the other way around, was by using a headset, which none of the girls had on at the moment. So the only ones I could communicate with was Jennifer and Connie.

“CAREFUL GIRLS, LOWER YOUR VOICES WE DON’T WANT TO HURT OUR TINY FRIENDS.” Connie says noticing our pain.

“NOW GIRLS TODAY WE ARE GOING TO HAVE A NEW TEAMMATE JOINING US TODAY.” Connie says.

As soon as Connie said those words my heart began to speed up, and sweat appeared on my forehead, as I saw the 10 gigantic girls look at each other with curiosity.

“HIS NAME IS OLIN AND FROM TODAY ON WORD HE IS PART OF PSI-LOCK.” Connie says with a happy tone.

The girls all let out a collective gasp, each gasp had enough wind to start a class 5 hurricane. I could tell that the idea of a boy joining their team wasn’t something everyone was looking forward to, and yet their where a few individuals amongst the giantesses that had a smile on their face, which intern gave me a little bit of hope. Soon after a little bit of whispering amongst themselves, which wasn’t whispering to me, one of the girls finally razed her hand 🖐. The girl had long curly blond hair with eyes so blue that they looked like the sky on a beautiful summer day. The girls skin was also white.

“SERGEANT CONNIE?” The blond haired women said trying to get Connie’s attention.

“YES NICOLE?” Connie said looking at the giantess who’s name was Nicole.

“IF THIS MAN IS TO JOIN OUR TEAM MA’AM THEN WHERE IS HE?” Nicole asked.

“THE REASON AS TO WHY YOU GIRLS CANT SEE HIM IS BECAUSE HE IS A LILLIPUTIAN HE AT THIS MOMENT IS STANDING ON JENNIFERS HAND.” I heard Connie say in my headset.

I soon remembered that the monolithic women could not actually see my form standing at the distance they were currently standing at. I was just to small. But as soon as Connie explained to them what I was almost all of the girls let out a excited shriek, and almost every girl broke ranks to get a closer look at Jennifer’s hand which had me inside of it. It almost seemed like a avalanche of skin as the Brobdingnagian girls moved closer with footsteps strong enough to shake the very world. Once again I felt afraid and deep down I just wanted them all to stay away.

“Ahhhhhhhh!!!!!!!!” I yelled as I put my arms up to defend myself.

The whole area goes quite. I open my eyes and see why. Both me Jennifer and even Connie where surrounded by a blue barrier. I could tell that I was the cause of this phenomenon. Jennifer couldn’t help but let out a little gasp as she looked at the barrier that stood in between both her me and Connie and the 10 Brobdingnagian women on the other side. My whole body glowed with power, a power a lot stronger than last time it was unleashed.

Soon without warning the Barrier disappears and far off in the distance I could see the ten Brobdingnagian women looking at my minuscule form in shock. They must have been close enough to see me because their eyes where locked on me. I soon look up behind me to see that they where the the only ones. Bothe Jennifer and even Connie’s eyes where looking at me with complete shock. No one spoke a word and soon the salience made me feel a little uncomfortable 😣.

“Uh sorry.” I said in to my headphones.

Jennifer soon lets out a sigh 😔 as if she was excepting this outcome to happen and turns around to look at Connie.

“Connie I think you should start to explain.”

It took a little while for Connie to shake out of her daze, but as soon as she did she told the Brobdingnagian women the situation. Everyone was sitting down in a circle ⭕️ I believe they did this for my benefit to calm me down so that I didn’t unleash my power on accident like I did before. The story soon ended and once again everyone’s eyes where on me.

I could tell that everyone had mixed emotions about me, but their was only one person who made me feel a little uncomfortable. It was the girl with long black hair, who was giving Jennifer the devil glare. I soon found out her name was jasmine, Jazz for short. The way she looked at me when she spotted me in Jennifer’s hand before anybody sent chills down my spine. It wasn’t a look of hate but a look of desire of want. Other than her everyone else was pretty cool about me living with them.


“““WELCOME TO PSI-LOCK!!!!””” Everyone said in unison,

(End of flashback)

I layer on my back just thinking of the future. Soon light flooded inside of the once dark room signaling to all the dawn was soon approaching. I sat up and smiled

“Ok time to begin the day.”
1511111111212111.title: The things to remember, the ten girls of Psi-lock

1513.content:
Jeffery laid on the floor, holding his throat as he tried to take in wheezing, heavy breathes. It felt like someone was strangling him but there was no one else in the room but himself and her. Tears ran from his eyes as he stared at her standing on his coffee table, a smile on her face as she stared back at him.

“Tell me more about how cute I am, handsome boy,” Annie giggled as Jeffery let out a stifled gasp. He really was a handsome man, young, roughish good looks, a chiseled body and looking around his apartment she could see he was rich. He had the latest Gulliverian plasma television, fine art, and a leather sofa, all so nice, all new. All Annie had was a small three-bedroom apartment for her family. She grew up sharing a room with her younger sister while her brother got his own room. She had always resented that, until she learned what real suffering was.

“…Please…” He wheezed, looking at Annie pleadingly as he struggled to lift his hand. He let out a garbled scream as the pressure around his neck increased.

“Don’t tell me the big tough Gulliverian needs help from the wittle, helpless Lilliputian?” she mocked in a baby voice, her smiling growing wider and sinister as Jeffery’s jerked around, his body shutting down from lack of oxygen. Annie relaxed the pressure around his throat, not wanting this to end too soon. She hadn’t had this much fun in such a long time. She hadn’t been this focused when she took the last one, she had put too much pressure on his heart and he died too fast. This one was going to know suffering before she put him out of his misery.

“You’re doing this…” He gasped out; able to take a shaky breath with the psychic hands around his neck relaxing. He pointed at her, his hands uncontrollably shaking as he spit out one word. “…Monster.”

All the playfulness vanished from Annie’s face. Suddenly the adorable girl that had been messing with Jeffery was replaced by a hateful demon, glaring poison at the down human.

“What did you call me, you fucking hypocrite?” She hissed, her hold on his neck returning just as hard as ever. She started panting, not from any strain from choking Jeffery, rather her internal struggle not to tear his skull from his neck. Where did someone like him come off calling her that?

Jeffery Donner, a young handsome, well of Gulliverian that posted online listings for Lilliputian roommates that offered a safe, cheap home for anyone that wanted to live in Gullveria. He seemed kind and gentle when he first meets his roommates until he gets them alone. The men he likes to toy with, either stomping them or eating them. The women he uses to pleasure himself, often crushing them against his member. Annie wasn’t sure how many of her people he had killed; dozens, hundreds, it didn’t matter to her. He deserved to die for every single life he took.

She might have never found out about his hobby if he hadn’t boasted about it online. Annie still remembered the picture he posted with a tiny, naked Lilliputian woman lying on his tongue, crying her eyes out before she was swallowed. A monster is someone that kills for no reason but his own enjoyment. Jeffery only cared about his own sick power trip, not the victims he killed, not the families he left behind, the family’s who had nothing left but bitterness.

“Do you want to hear a story, Mr. Donner? It’s the kind of story you like, it’s about a Gulliverian killing and torturing an innocent family.” Annie spoke in a completely deadpan voice, her eyes going vacant as she lost herself in a nightmare she kept reliving every night. Even though her mind was elsewhere, she maintained her hold around her victims neck, giving him just enough air to stay awake, but not enough to move.

“It’s about a mommy, daddy, big brother, big sister and little sister. They were poor, but happy because all they needed was each other. One day mommy decided to take everyone for a picnic near a Gulliverian town. It was such a nice day, everyone was so happy and laughing. Then the Gullverians showed up. Two of them, lets call them bastard and bitch. At first mommy and daddy weren’t afraid, but then bastard stepped on daddy. No one was laughing anymore except bastard and bitch.”

Lifting up off the coffee table, Annie hovered above Jeffery staring down at him with her wide, soulless eyes, not seeing the handsome man that murdered her people with promises of shelter, but the man that had destroyed her life. Gritting her teeth, she willing Jeffery to lift off the ground, joining her in the air. Only he was being held up by his neck, the strangling hands around his neck became a noose, tightening slowly as Annie continued her story.

“Mommy ran to daddy but he was nothing but a smear on the ground. Bitch picked up mommy and laughed at her, finding her tears funny. Mommy screamed at bitch and then mommy went into her mouth and was all gone, poof,” a jarring giggle escaped Annie as she found herself shaking. She was able to maintain flight, but she couldn’t control her own shaking as the memory flashed past her eyes.

“Big brother grabbed little sister and tried to run, but the Bitch caught them. She lifted them up high into the air, hundreds of feet over big sister’s head, and the dropped them. They went splat right in front of big sister, very messy, very messy. Big sister was all alone, no mommy, no daddy, no big brother, no little sister. But then big sister found something inside her, something that had always been there but she’d never used before. Big sister looked at bastard as he reached for her and he made his fucking head explode. Brains and blood everywhere. Now only big sister was laughing. She laughed and laughed and laughed.”

Jeffery made a death rattle as his eyes rolled back into his skull. He was fading fast, Annie had put too much pressure on his neck and he was going to black out. Not wanting thing to end like that Annie concentrated on his neck, she focused her every iota of her rage and hate on Jeffery and let it all out in one blast of telekinetic force.

CRACK!

Jeffery’s head twisted to the side violently and he creased breathing. Annie let him fall to the ground as a lifeless heap, leaving him there to rot until the smell of his corpse alerted his neighbors.

That had been good, very good; it would keep her satisfied for at least a week. She needed to keep doing this, not just because they deserved it but also because it was the only thing keeping her from losing her mind. She had gotten the male Gulliverian that killed her family, but not the woman. She had escaped after the man died, running away as Annie laughed.

Annie had been searching for her, practicing on monsters like her so when they meet she can do more then kill her. Simply murdering the woman wasn’t enough, she wanted to destroy her happiness, tear everything she loved and cared about away and make death seem like a sweet release. It was only fair; she had done the same to Annie.

154211.title: Lilliputian size

154212.content:
Alissa and Jackie looked on with horrified fascination at the green swirling portal that formed entirely inside the closet.

Both friend’s were having a girl’s night out. They were in Alissa’s room playing with makeup and picking the perfect outfit, when the portal formed out of nowhere. It was accompanied with a twangy electronic sound and constant breeze.

“What is that Alissa?”

“How should I know?”

“It’s in your room!”

“I’ve never seen that before.”

Alissa had a comb in her hand. Without putting much thought into her actions, she tossed the comb at the swirling green portal. The portal jiggled like gelatin as it swallowed the comb.

“Where did it go?”

Alissa got closer to the portal. Her dress and light-brown hair flowed back with the breeze emanating from the portal.Her barefeet padded across the shaggy carpeting in her room until she was a step away from the portal. It was amazingly detailed. It looked like a flat, 2D portal at first, but now that she was a step away, she could see that the center of the portal extended back for an infinite distance. It was like looking down the funnel of a tornado.

“Give me something.” Alissa demanded from Jackie.

The latina noticed only then, that she was paralyzed with fear. She was still clutching to two bottles of nail polish. With only a slight moment of hesitation, she padded across the room and handed her friend the bottles.

Alissa had her hand extended back, and without turning away from the portal, she felt for the bottles and promptly tossed them at the portal. Again, it jiggled and absorbed the bottles. This time, Alissa could see the bottles getting smaller and smaller as it was pulled through the vortex.

“Oh my god!” Alissa had to raise her voice, as the ambient sounds of the portal increased. “This is like that thing from that one show.”

“Rick and Morty?” Asked Jackie, also raising her voice.

“No, Sliders.”

“Where do think it goes?” Asked Jackie. She felt the breeze coming from the portal changing. Instead of blowing out, it felt like it was sucking in. At first, she didn’t feel any need to be alarmed. The breeze was probably only like 10 mph at most. Nothing to fear.

“I don’t freaking know Jackie. But I kinda want to find out.”

“Don’t do it Alissa. What if it shreds your body in a million pieces? What if you end up in the middle of space?” The sucking winds started picking up. Both girls’ hair were now flowing in front of their faces, obstructing their views.

“Yea, you’re probably right.” Alissa was nearly shouting at this point. “Maybe we should throw a mouse in there or something.”

“That’s stupid. How would we know it surv--”

A gust of wind knocked both girls forward. Their small bodies didn’t stand a chance to the wall of wind that struck their backs. Alissa, followed by Jackie, were thrown into the portal.
154212.title: Gulliverian size

choices: They spot a Lilliputian in a dune buggy
1542121.content:
Jackie landed on top of her friend with a thump. “Get off me.” She felt Alissa push her off with reactionary force. Jackie hadn’t got her bearings and was still disoriented from the trip through the portal. She landed face first on the flat ground.

The trip through the portal was unlike any experience known to humankind. It felt like she was skydiving, but she also felt her body distort and pull itself in all directions as if she was made of putty. She felt no gravity or free fall sensation, instead she felt like she was being sucked through a straw.

“Where are we?” Jackie groaned.

“Jackie, how in the hell should I know. This is all new to me too.” Alissa sounded like a mother frustrated with her kid asking a million questions.

They were outside. Sunny, no clouds in the sky. It felt warm and a little dry. The ground was hot. It felt like there was a fine film of sand on top of a hard, compacted ground. As Jackie planted her hands on the ground to push herself up, she felt the ground give-in just a bit.

Jackie was was wearing a long, plaid skirt with simple v-neck black t-shirt. Her friend was in a modest dress, that was cut in the front to show off her leg as she walked. Both girls were barefoot.

“This place looks really flat.” Alissa shielded her eyes from the sun with one hand. It looked like a lazy salute. “We’re in desert it appears.”

Jackie could feel the compacted-ground sink under her bare feet. She looked down and moved her right foot and stood a little wide. Where her right foot was, she could see a perfect footprint in the light-sanded color ground.

“I don’t like this, ‘Lissa. We are in a desert with no water.”

“So, I guess we should start looking for water.”

“That portal thingy is gone. We’re trapped here.”

“Don’t freak out.”

“What are we going to do?”

“Find water. Then we’ll see if we can find anyone else.”

The girls pick a direction and proceed to walk. They hope their decision leads to fresh water or civilization.

As they walk, Jackie couldn’t help but notice how fragile the ground felt. Something felt off but she couldn’t pinpoint it. Jackie walked slightly behind her taller friend and kept close. The sun stayed high above and warmed their skins, causing them to slightly sweat.

“There look!” Alissa pointed off into the distance.
1542121.title: They end up in Lilliput

choices: Go thru the portal; take Lilliputians with them
Go thru the portal; leave alone
15421211.content:
“What was that?” Jackie asked.

“I can’t tell. It looked like a small animal. But I’m positive it wasn’t it wasn’t a snake or something.”

“I thought I saw a toy for a second.”

They took timid steps towards the rolling sand dunes, where they saw the movement. The sand dunes didn’t necessarily look like dunes to the girls. They more or less looked like gentle little slopes of sand that rose up level with their shins. Their feet kicked up the powdery sand and left compacted footprints in the wake of their walk.

Jackie kept studying her environment. Everything felt so familiar, yet it all felt alien. Slightly off.

The hot sand warmed their bare soles but it wasn’t anything painful. The warm sand actually felt nice under the arches of their feet. The fineness of the sand also felt oddly comfortable to walk on.

“There! It didn’t get far.” Alissa pointed at another dune, about 4-steps ahead of them.

“It looks like a car.”

“It looks like an RC car. Look! It’s moving away from us.”

“Should we follow it?” Asked Jackie.

“Yes. The owner isn’t probably too far off.”

The RC car sped away from the girls. It raced up the little hills of the dune, only to catch air at the apex, before crashing down on the other side. Though it took the dunes effortlessly and sped at top gear, the girls caught up with the 2-inch long buggy.

Alissa reached the toy first and bent down to pick it up, but it quickly drifted right beyond her grasp. Jackie acted and stomped her left foot in front of the toy. The dune buggy took a hard right turn, but the drastic change in direction was enough for it to flip over once, landing on top of Jackie’s right foot. The little toy was stunned long enough for Jackie to pluck it with her thumb and index finger. She stood back up and brought the toy to her face.

Jackie noticed how fragile the toy felt. She could feel the outer piece bending and crumpling within her light grasp. Secondly, the toy looked incredibly detailed. The engine to the rear of the buggy was hot and had visible moving parts, so small, she could barely make them out.

“Oh my god.” Jackie said under her breath.

“What? What’s up?” Alissa walked over to her friend.

“Look.”

Alissa moved in closer to see the little toy. “Holy shit. Is that...it’s moving.”

“It looks real.”

“It looks like a little person.”

“Either this is some kind of super detailed toy or…” Jackie’s mind wondered off as she continued examining the one-inch figure in the driver's seat of the buggy. The little figure moved its arm and proceeded to take off its full-face helmet.

Alissa gulped. She couldn’t believe what she was seeing. She looked up to her friend and noticed, she too, was looking up at her with mouth wide-open.

The little figure started yelling at the girls and even shook a fist in the sky. The little thing didn’t see scared of the girls. Rather, the little thing seemed pissed.

“It’s real.” Jackie finally said. “A real, tiny person.”

“I think it’s trying to say something to us.” Alissa moved her ear close to the little figure. (Later, they would learn the little thing is a Lilliputian.) “I can’t understand what it’s saying. It doesn’t sound like a language I recognize.”

“The little person isn’t a thing.” Jackie cocked her head. “Stop saying ‘it.’”

“Well, what else should I call it?”

“Little...man, I dunno.”

“Do you think there are more of him?” Alissa looked up excitingly at her friend.

“Why?”

“Well, maybe they can help us and get water or figure out where we are.”

“Oh.” Jackie thought for a second while looking at the irate Lilliputian. “Well, yea. He wouldn’t be way out here by himself--”

“--right! Which means there should be more of him around.”

“Why are you so eager to find more of him?”

“I’ll tell you later.” Alissa was busy looking around her immediate area, looking for clues or evidence of more little people. “Look. I see a lot of tire tracks heading that way.”

As they headed toward the direction of the tire tracks, Alissa gently took the dune buggy from Jackie’s hand. Alissa was transfixed on the little man. Jackie thought it was cute how her taller friend was so interested on the tiny man. Jackie was too, but Alissa looked at the man with intense, rapt interest.

“Whoa. It’s a whole campsite, filled with little people.” Jackie crouched down and marveled at the sight. There were RVs, a bonfire, BBQ grills, dune buggies, ATVs, 4 trucks parked in a circle. And at least 15 little people ranging in ages, male and female. They looked very human (except for their size) and wore clothes similar to what was found on Earth. All the Lilliputians looked back up at the girls and were motionless. Jackie noted that the little people didn’t look fearful. They looked up at them as if they crashed a party -- the fact that they appeared 400-feet tall didn’t seem the phase them.

“I want them all.’ Alissa said coldly.

Before Jackie could respond. The portal materialized out of nowhere.

“It’s back, Alissa. Quick, let’s go through it and get back home before it disappears.”

The girls didn’t know for sure if the portal went back home or not. But jumping through seemed like a great idea. Better to go through the portal than be stuck on a desert as giantesses.

“Uhm…” Alissa looked at the campsite, unsure what to do next.

154232.content:
Forty-year-old Maria is what the humans of Earth would call a mad scientist. She is incredibly intelligent, good-looking, and she has the Earth equivalent of several doctorate degrees in many of the advanced sciences. However, her mentally unhinged, cruel, and perverted personality has made her a renegade when it comes to most of the great scientific minds of her world. However, she found a good paying job with other, twisted, like-minded, mad scientist types on a former Brobdingnag military base now run by the Brob mega corporation Acme. Their goal is to find new lands to plunder, and new resources to exploit. Maria has a slender, yet curvy body, with a nice, firm, round ass, and large, perky breasts. She has smooth, milk chocolate colored skin, lovely black hair, and haunting brown eyes. On Earth, this bisexual woman would be considered model material, or an incredibly hot milf. However, she would stand out on Earth, because she would stand over 400 of their feet tall.

Currently, Maria is at the base getting ready to go through a movable, vortex like wormhole portal. There are advanced computers, advanced robots, other scientists, military security personnel, company personnel, and technician all around her, as she stands there dressed in an armored, dark colored space suit. “What data is the remote probe sending us,” Maria yells.

“The new target planet is remarkably like our world, only their atmosphere is slightly thinner than ours, and so is the gravity, perfect for a Gullivarien, but still not lethal or even burdensome for our people,” the tech told her. “In addition, the plant life, and some of the animal life is nearly the same as one would find on the Gullivarien homeland.”

“Nearly,” Maria asked.

“Yes, the life forms on this world are just slightly bigger than one would find on the Gullivarien homeland,” the tech tells her.

“Any sign of human or intelligent life?” Maria asks.

“None so far,” the tech tells her.

“What a shame, nobody will be there for me to play with,” Maria responds.

Maria puts on her helmet, just in case the robots readings are wrong. She grabs a large bag filled with various kinds of equipment, and walks through the wormhole. She quickly emerges on the other side, and checks her instruments. For a few minutes, she believes she is still on her home world. However, after checking the configuration of the stars in the night sky, she realizes that she is really on another world. Maria removes her helmet, and gloves, placing them near the advanced, squid looking robot, which runs on bio-fuel that is standing next to her. The robot is designed to collect, and store living specimens for the return home. It can also use living creatures as a fuel source. It can easily suck them up, or grab living specimens with its long tentacles, without harming them. Both Maria and the robot can become invisible at will.

Maria orders the robot to stay around this area, and collect any living specimens it deems interesting. Meanwhile, Maria activates her portable cloaking device and walks even farther away, in order to have a good look around, in the search for interesting specimens. Maria comes across what kind of miniature structure?

154233.title: Prodigian size

155.content:
If the size ratio between the three races wasn’t enough—

For centuries, the three races in the Swift Universe learned to cope and live side by side despite their extreme size difference. Discovered just over a century ago, were two new races of humans that took the size ratio into a ridiculous realm. No longer were the Brobdingnagians the biggest of the big. No longer were the Lilliputians the smallest of the small.

The Prodigians lived on an unexplored continent across a vast sea. Their population was only in the thousands and far behind in technology. The Brobdingnagians who discovered these people made a concentrated effort to bring peace and assimilate the giants. In only a hundred years, the Prodigians adopted the cultures of the three original races. They took in the fashion, language, and laws of the little people. Fortunately, for the world, the Prodigians hold little aggression and are compassionate towards the little people. Yet, there are those that let their size get to their heads.

The Microputians lived under the noses of the three original races for centuries. Knowing their limitations in stature and seeing how the bigger people treated the Lilliputians, the Microputians opted for a life of subterfuge. They scavenged off the giant Lilliputians and avoided anyone bigger. Their discovery devastated them, for they no longer could scavenge and live a free life within the walls of the giants. Over a hundred years after their discovery, the Microputians accepted their new lot in life as the smallest of the small.
