“Don’t get all sappy on me.” Kelly turned her attention to the Lilliputian cities on a nearby table. “I know how I want to test the compound.”

-One Year Later-


“I thought Atlantis was going to be some kind of a Utopia.” Manny said with a heavy alcoholic breath. “They told me to move to Atlantis for opportunity and adventure. They promised me an easy job, a fat salary, and a big apartment. You know I was one of the last groups of immigrant before Atlantis was sunk?”

“I didn’t know that.” A man in a sharp suit said.

“So, the city was sunk, I got my job assignment: exterior window cleaner. One of the most useless fucking jobs someone could have, oh and let us not forget the small paycheck it comes with every two weeks. To make things worse, they gave me the smallest apartment they could find. I’ve been to truck stop restrooms that were bigger than my shithole apartment.”

“Brother, it can’t be all bad.” The suit said. He was drinking a fine dark wine in the dimly lit bar. It was nearing three in the morning, and only pathetic drunks were present. However, the man in the suit did seem out of place. “You’re not a farmer after all. Their accidental death rate is through the roof and at least you got an apartment where you live alone. Some unlucky folks are stuck in the barracks. Imagine sharing a warehouse with a hundred cots.”

“Who are you? Some kind of shrink?” Manny asked.

“Just a concerned citizen, brother.”

Manny blinked a few times, but wasn’t able to rid of the double vision he was seeing. “You must have an easy life in the city. You’re probably some executive that sits behind a desk all day. You don’t have to scrape shit from the outside while wearing a diving suit that could leak any second and kill you. Fuck, I hate this place so much.”

“Careful what you say, brother.”

“No, no, no, I mean it. I fucking hate this place. I hate being at constant risk of death. I hate not being able to see the sky or true outdoors, I hate my job, I hate my life…I hate the fucking bitch I’m inside.”

The man in the suit took one last sip of his wine. He placed it down on the bar and adjusted the cufflinks at each of his wrists.

Manny’s drink did its job of numbing him all over. He was standing at the bar with only one ass cheek on the bar stool. His body struggled to stay still and instead wavered back and forth.

“I told you, brother,” the suit said turning to Manny. “To watch what you say. You know the penalty for blasphemy against the Order.”

“Huh?” The drink in Manny’s belly was on the verge of traveling back up his throat. He was too drunk. “What, are you going to report me? This is just guy talk. Besides, I don’t see any Enforcers anywhere.”

“How about undercover Enforcers?”

“Oh goddamnit.” Even drunk Manny knew what this meant. “So, what now?”

-Two Days Later-


“Manny?” Abigail asked. “Where have you been? I’ve been trying to call you for days now.”

“Jail,” he said, sitting beside her on the bench at the botanical garden. An enormous dome was right above their heads, allowing some of the taller trees ample space. The thick acrylic windows around the garden let in an eerie yellow hue from the outside.

“Oh, god why?” She caressed his shoulder as he slumped over.

“For making disparaging remarks about our so-sigh-ity.” He said in a tone mimicking the mayor and his accent. “The court said they’ll let me off easy since I have a spotless record. Fucking assholes. They reassigned me as a farmer.”

“Oh my god.”

“I’m as good as dead.”

“No, don’t say that. Maybe we can file an appeal or something?”

“Don’t you get it Abbie? You can’t win with these people. Shit, I should be watching what I say right now otherwise they’ll eject me out the city without a suit.” Manny looked around the immediate area and didn’t see anything out of the ordinary. Only other Lilliputians in suits enjoy another day in paradise.

“This isn’t a police state, honey.” Abigail said. “They don’t have cameras and microphones everywhere.”

“It’s not them I’m worried about. It’s the undercover Enforcers.”

Abigail swallowed a lump.

“At least I have you babe.” Manny reached in and gave Abbie, his girlfriend, a kiss.”

The couple walked around the gardens for an hour before heading to the cafeteria. They talked about light topics and ate their foul tasting food—they didn’t consider it food, but the rest of the city seemed content with their meal options.

The couple called it a night and headed back to their respective domiciles. Manny headed for his hole-in-the-wall apartment and Abbie went to her upper-class suite. Transportation in Atlantis consisted of fast moving train cars, interconnected throughout the city via a series of acrylic tubes.

Abigail swiped her transport card through the slot adjacent to a tube entrance. She had to wait a minute for a private train car to show up. Abbie sat down alone and waited for the train to get moving. It was quiet inside the train car as it zipped through the clear tubes. Abbie placed a call on her private phone.
155122.title: Weird Science

1551221.content:
“Hello?” Kelly answered her phone without looking at the caller ID.

“It’s me Abbie.”

“Oh hi girl!” Kelly was still in her bed despite the sun being up and shining bright into her bedroom. The only thing she had on was her black lace panties. Between her long legs were several firm pillows. White silky sheets draped over her luscious buttocks and spilled over her hips. “How are things going in Atlantis?”

“The usual.” Abbie said. “Listen, I got a friend here who got into a lot of trouble. I was wondering if you can help him out.”

“Abbie, you know there’s nothing I can do. Remember, I’m totally hands off. The people govern themselves, the way they want to govern themselves.”

“I know, I know, but come on. I really like him.”

“Abbie, darling, I told you before you embarked on this experiment not to get attached to anyone.”

“I know Kelly.” Abbie sighed. “I just thought. Ugh, I don’t know.”

“Where are you now?” Kelly slowly rose from her bed. She swung herself off her extra-large bed and headed for the bathroom for her morning pee.

“I’m heading home for the night.”

“Oh that’s funny.” Kelly relaxed her bladder and continued talking to her lab assistant. “I forget you guys are on a different time than me.”

Abbie looked out the train as it hurled itself through the cylindrical tube. The city lit the liquid that was on the outside but there wasn’t a whole lot to see. Just a vacant ocean devoid of life. Atlantis was the sunken city surviving under a harsh ocean. It was considered the last safe haven for the Lilliputians; safe from the much larger and terrorizing races. Abbie didn’t feel safe in Atlantis, and neither did Manny—which was probably why she liked him. All the Lilliputians in the city were there by choice and never questioned the status quo.

Manny challenged them. All the time. His big fat mouth and liberal mind had gotten him in trouble many times in the past. And now he was assigned as a farmer, which meant almost certain death. It was a dangerous job no one wanted, yet the entire city depended on farmers for food and survival.

The reason the job was so dangerous was because he had to go on the outside in a flimsy wet suit. A ceramic compound, that Abbie and Kelly developed a year ago, would protect him from the harsh ocean. The same compound also protected the sunken Lilliputian city from the the outside.

“Do you have a view of the ocean?” Kelly flushed her toilet and walked to her kitchen.

“Yea, I’m taking the tube home. All I see is dark ocean around me.”

Kelly was still wearing only her panties. On her kitchen counter were three square pieced crackers, each half the size of a postage stamp. Kelly’s mouth watered as she looked at the three tiny crackers on her clean, white counter.

The crackers didn’t look like much; in fact, it looked like left over crumbs. But there was something about the crackers that made Kelly excited. Each cracker was teeming with life. Kelly wished she could see herself from the perspective of the Microputians occupying the crackers in their miniscule cities. She always wondered what she looked like as a 30,700-mile tall giantess.

Each cracker occupied anywhere from 70 to 90 million Microputians. There buildings were coated and treated with the ceramic compound, but the city and its people were out in the open.

Still holding her phone to her ear, Kelly picked up one cracker as carefully as she could. “Good, look outside because I got a treat for you.” Kelly said with a husky voice as she brought the tiny cracker to her plush lips.

“Oh Kelly, please don’t tell me you’re going to…” Abbie’s voice trailed off as she looked out into the absent ocean.

Kelly placed the cracker on her tongue. The cracker soaked up the saliva on Kelly’s tongue and the city on the surface began to crumble under the uneven surface. Like dominoes, buildings collided with other buildings as they were shaken off their foundation; the buildings did not disintegrate or break away as expected thanks to the compound they were coated with. The people in the cities cried out for mercy but they knew their voices wouldn’t carry all the way out to the giantess. Kelly swallowed the damp cracker and the millions of Microputians.

Abbie’s train car was still swirling around the various tubes that connected Atlantis together. The tubes left the confines of the building and traveled out in the open. She looked outside and could see distant buildings lit up with their neon and halogen lights of all color. It was weird how the lights interacted with the Kelly’s stomach acid.

The first parts of the Microputian city started to enter Kelly’s stomach. For the most part, the ceramic compound held up the integrity of the Microputian structures, but gradually melted in Kelly’s stomach. Abbie looked on and could see one inch Microputians enter Kelly’s stomach, only to be digested painfully within the vast ocean. Their tiny writhing bodies didn’t last long.

Kelly grabbed another cracker and ate it like the one previous. Kelly moaned at the thought of consuming some 180 million little lives with two little swallows. Hundreds of thousands of Microputians adhered to Kelly’s esophagus, only to drown on the slimy interior of her throat. Though many perished in her mouth and throat, millions made it to her stomach were they would suffer a far more painful death.

The freefalling Microputians looked out their office buildings in terror as they entered the vast open stomach. They could see many lights illuminated under the sea of stomach acid. Their little heads couldn’t comprehend what they were seeing—or why a Prodigian would eat so many of them even though they wouldn’t provide much nourishment to her gigantic body.

The Microputians broke through the stomach acid and dove deep, deep into Kelly’s stomach. Some Microputians were able to figure it all out in the moments before their death. It was a Lilliputian city built inside the Prodigian’s stomach. Somehow, the Lilliputian city was anchored to the slimy walls of Kelly’s stomach. The city withstood the harsh environment of the stomach and wasn’t eaten through thanks to the ceramic compound. However, the ceramic compound that was treated on the Microputian city wasn’t strong enough to withstand the violent acid.

Kelly’s stomach acid digested the Microputian city little by little. Kelly digested the Microputians by the millions. Their collective bodies providing barely a calorie to her enormous body.

Kelly lifted the last cracker. Lust was written all over her face. She parted her lips and showed off her white teeth—one tooth was large enough to support an entire Microputian county and then some. Kelly chewed on the last cracker. Her diamond hard teeth shredded apart countless structure and millions of people. Entire neighborhoods lodged themselves within the valley of her molars, only to be crushed seconds later. Even though she chewed the cities in her wet mouth, millions were still alive and clinging desperately for higher ground. Kelly swallowed, and then moaned. There were still hundreds of thousands alive in her mouth.

Kelly felt up her large tits. She patted her taut belly that was both home and hell to millions of people. She loved eating. Every time she ate, her breasts grew larger and her legs longer. It only took hundreds of millions of lives for her body to expand.

“How was the show?” Kelly said into the phone.

Abbie could see the last structure sinking by the tube where she was. The skinny office building was about four times her height and filled with panicking Microputians. She could see their one-inch bodies scrambling for dry floors, but the violent stomach acid found its way into the building and was mercilessly eating away at anything it met.

One after another, the fast moving acid took Microputian lives by the hundreds. Their bodies dissolved into nothingness as Kelly’s stomach worked on digesting every morsel. Soon, the structure broke in half by the acidic ocean. The Microputians didn’t stand a chance. In little less than three seconds, the thousands occupying the city were digested.

“Scary.” Abby managed to say.

“Don’t worry honey. Nothing bad will happen to you.”
1551221.title: Continue -->

choices: Sorry, but your friend's a farmer
Your friend's not a farmer but...
15512212.content:
"Kelly, I know I promised to not become too attached, but this is 1 exception. Can you please make that exception, for me?"

The brown titaness looked down at her stomach within which all this drama was underway and contemplated for a bit. True she was meant to stay out of the business of the people beneath her notice. But it couldn't have been possible without Abby.

"All right honey. Give me some time. I'll let you know what we work out."

"Thank you, Kelly. I appreciate everything."

"I hope so honey. If it weren't for me, you'd be dinner."

Abby put down the phone and looked out the tube at the sickening ocean outside. It was true. She remembered seeing Kelly for the first time. Still a Lilliputian staring up at a landmass, not a person. She didn't know how she made her out amidst all the specks at her feet. But somehow she took an interest in her. From there she found herself under various experiments by the goddess. She underwent numerous tests, eventually growing from a Lilliputian to a Gulliverian, then to a Brobdingnagian and finally a Prodigian. Even at that size, Kelly still overshadowed her in every way.

And now here she was, back on the bottom of the food chain only second to the Microputians, literally within the belly of the beast.

She wasn't sure how this would turn out. She knew Kelly cared for her, but that care was not spread evenly throughout the rest of the subjects of her stomach.

She noticed something else out in the vast sea. It appeared to be a massive piece of toast. It would soon be refuged by the farmers for consumption by the locals. Many would not be coming back sadly.

She got back to her flat and fell down on the bed. She had noticed throughout her time her that there was no such thing as true silence here. If you listened hard enough, you could hear the sounds of the stomach all around. The groaning and gurgling. A constant reminder of how close they were to being dinner at every second.

And now Manny might very well be that dinner if Kelly couldn't get through to the leaders.

She got a call just then. She examined it: Kelly.

"Hey girl. I just spoke with the top dogs. So here's the deal..."

She made it back to her flat and fell down on the
15512212.title: Kelly communicates with Atlantis

choices: Katy: Champions for equal rights in the faces of the giants
Alicia: Looking for her long lost sister in a faraway land
1552.content: The Microputians are an inch tall in comparison to the Lilliputians. They have accepted the fact they are smaller than small and that there are people in the world that are just as big as the world. The Lilliputians are now able to assert their size and dominance on the little people, as they were never able to before. The populations of the Microputians is in the trillions of trillion with no shortage in sight. Unfortunately, this means the larger races seek them for nefarious purposes.
1552.title: Microputians

15522.content: Alicia eats her meal as she looks out across the landscape. She lost her sister to this treacherous region nearly 5 years ago, but she won't rest until she finds her again. After all, she's one of the only Microputians she knows. Most of the towns she finds are either destroyed or about to be. And sure, she also sees the occasional Lilliputian (and they sometimes see her), but other than that this whole area is void of civilization. But she knows she'll find her sister: she taught Alicia everything she knows about survival. As she packs up her few belongings, we zoom out to see exactly what barren wasteland our hero lives in.
15522.title: Survival of the smallest

choices: Jennifer will be cleaning the kitchen
155221.content:
The tiny girl was one of a million Microputians (and a few hundred Lilliputians) that lived on a vast and cold desert. This terrifying and desolate wasteland was actually the marble counter top in the house of a Prodigian family, the Helners. The family includes Julie, the middle-aged wife; Mark, the husband; and Jennifer, the college-age daughter. This family is actually quite progressive, and have just as many Brobby and Gulliverian friends as others their age. Jennifer also knows a few Lilliputians and even Microputians online. However, none of them are aware of the colony in their own kitchen: the only people with a hope of noticing the tinies are Gulliverians, and they tend to stay in the safe zones inside the house. Meanwhile, the Helners remain unaware of the devastation they cause every time they place something on the kitchen island.

Food and water is surprisingly difficult to come by. The occasional bread crumb or water drop was a miles tall obstacle, crashing down like a meteor. Even if you survive, you have to quickly grab supplies and run for cover. At any moment, a massive wall will sweep the small mess away, returning the vast landscape to its bare form. During her travels, Alicia has found villages that disappear overnight, with not a single trace left. She's even reached the World's End, a massive drop that supposedly surrounds the world. And of course, the landscape changes constantly with monolithic objects crashing down and flying away. The ground regularly rumbles, but Alicia doesn't know that this is from the movement of beings that are larger than planets to her.

Today, the sunlight returns to show that the land is empty today. As Alicia sets out with her pack, she's unaware that today...
155221.title: A Prodigian's kitchen counter

choices: She manages to escape the bowl
1552211.content:
Alicia's walking has become more sluggish. According to her map, there were only a few other places her sister could possibly be. And if she's not there...

No, focus. Shaking her head, she hears the distant sound of thunder. Time for the daily storm. As massive clouds roll overhead, the heavy wind was mixed with large boulders. Alicia quickly found a small cave and hid. The white rocks pounded the landscape, each one bigger than a house to her. She even watched a poor Lilliputian getting pelted by the debris, slowly succumbing to the bludgeoning wounds. The clouds retreated for a moment before returning, much larger this time. The off-white cloud descended toward the ground. As it neared, Alicia noticed that it wasn't a cloud, but a sprawling blob of gunk! The amorphous mass plummeted to the ground, landing with a massive...

...plop. Julie was humming to herself as she kneaded the dough. She's never tried making bread on her own, but so far the recipe was working great! Just a bit of work on the counter top, then let it sit and rise for a few hours. After that, a short bake in the oven and voila! Fresh bread for dinner! She finishes working the dough, and tosses it into a nearby metal bowl. Covering the top, she places it beside the fridge, and heads to the living room.

Alicia was trapped in an endless mass of food. She was lucky enough to be caught in an air bubble, but she still screamed as she was tossed about. After a few minutes of terror, the movements cease. Alicia claws through the thick mixture, and arrives at the summit of a mountain of dough. She looks up just in time to see a massive shape stretch a thick sheet across the roof, sealing the container shut. She needs to get out of here.
1552211.title: Armabreadon

15522111.content: Inexplicably, the mass of dough began to swell in size. This movement gave Alicia just enough of a boost to climb the metallic wall. After a grueling ascent, she reaches an infinitesimal hole in the plastic ceiling, and jumps. She falls for hundreds of miles before landing on the wasteland. She pulls out her map and tries to find her location, but nothing looks familiar. However, she notices a similar drop off right in front of her. This place must be beyond the void, a world away from her home! Suddenly, the monolithic bowl rises into the air, leaving behind a confused and terrified Microputian. She looks around for signs of shelter. Peering over the edge, she can see a massive cliff just below her, filled with enormous metal shapes. Behind her is a large mesa, colored in yellow and black stripes. It also appears to be made of metal.
15522111.title: She manages to escape the bowl

choices: Sandy feels her and scratches her foot
155221112.content:
"Hey Julie!" A voice appeared in the Prodigian's ear. It was her best friend, a Gulliverian named Sandy. She always visited her around this time, appearing at the safety zone near the fridge. As Julie continues to work with the bread, she begins the daily ritual of gossip with her friend.

To Alicia, the event was anything but normal. Before her stood a person larger than any she's encountered. The gigantic human was easily miles tall, and her voice was booming. Alicia ponders this newcomer for a moment, and decided she should grab her attention; maybe she would know what's going on. She chases after the giantess's shoe, which idly shifts about as she idly talks to...someone. Eventually she reaches the flip-flop, and easily scales the cliff-face. She continues climbing up the massive foot when...
155221112.title: Head towards the platform

1552211121.content:
Sandy felt a scratch on her foot and reached down to get it. Catching something on her fingernail, she lifted it up to inspect. It looked to be some kind of microscopic bug, but it was far too small for her to tell.

Suddenly she sneezed. When she looked back at the fingernail, the bug was gone. Blown off by her sneeze.

"Gesundheit," her massive friend boomed from above.

"Thank you," Sandy replied. She shrugged her shoulders. She would have liked to get a closer look at the insect, but nothing special lost.

The same could not be said for Alicia. One minute, she found herself scrapped off the foot by a gargantuan nail and staring into eyes larger than her home. The next she was blown off across a greater distance than she had ever traveled in her life.

She screamed, thinking this was the end. But alas, she came smack into and tangled up in some kind of rough fabric. Little did she know, it was merely the sleeve of an even larger person.

She could do little but hold on for dear life as the area around her moved. The prodigian continued to make the bread and chat with her gulliverian friend, completely oblivious to the plight of her miniature passenger trapped on her wrist.

After god knows how long, the shaking subsided. Alicia finally caught her breath for a brief second, and tried to figure out where she was and where to go from here. Unfortunately this relief was short-lived as she suddenly felt the ground slip out form under her again.

"I'll be right back Sandy. Just stay near the fridge, ok?"

"Sure thing."

And so Alicia held onto the massive sleeve as it swung too and fro with each swing of the giant woman's arm as she walked to...
1552211121.title: Sandy feels her and scratches her foot

15522111211.content:
Poor Alicia. First she encounters the largest person she's ever seen in her life, too big to notice here. Now she's on some alien landscape, sweeping back and forth with the force of a rocket. Blurry objects zoom past, each as large as a continent to the Microputian. She gets a bad feeling: she may never return to her home. But as she thinks more, she realizes something. Maybe this is how her sister disappeared! If she can just hang on, maybe she'll be taken to where she is! With that in her mind, she doubles her efforts to stay lodged in the city-sized thread.

Julie continued to her bedroom, unaware of the desperate fight for survival at the edge of her shirt sleeve. She managed to cover herself in flour while baking the bread, and retired to her room for a quick change.

The swinging stopped, but was soon replaced by a monumental grinding sound. Alicia felt herself slide upwards as the wiry landscape glides upwards. A hole opens beneath Alicia, and she notices the pink landscape of Julie's skin. Now she's got to make a choice: stay on the fabric, or jump down to the pink surface?
15522111211.title: Her Bedroom

155221112111.content:
Alicia decides to stay put. She'd rather not jump down from a fast-moving land mass. Suddenly, the overhead lights are surrounded by shadows as...

...Julie takes off her shirt. With a practiced throw it lands in the laundry hamper, one sleeve hanging off the edge. She finds a purple top in the closet, slides it on, and leaves to finish baking. She'll take care of her laundry later.

Blinded, Alicia could only feel the g-forces of her world moving. Suddenly, another rocket launch and she goes airborne. A few seconds later, the mass of fabric slams into an even larger pile. The crash knocks Alicia's grasp and sends her tumbling...
155221112111.title: Stay on the shirt

1552211121112.content:
Alicia tumbled down the plane of cloth off and into freefall. Soon she found herself falling into a forest of fibers that would proportionally be taller than the empire state building! She grabbed onto one of the many hairs which eased her fall onto the ground below the fibers. Looking up, she saw a wide plane of what appeared to be... flesh!?

Alicia paled. This was a human being? She gaped in awe as the plane walked away, causing a rumbling sound that shook her to her core.

Alicia hugged her knees to her chest and cried. She was out of her league here. Surrounded by people taller than mountains. Surely her sister was dead. She should have stayed home. She sobbed trapped with no way out.

Julie by contrast was having a fine time, baking bread and chatting with Sandy. Sandy was mentioning the miniature bug she had found on her finger, when Julie felt a pair of arms wrap around her.

"How did the bread go?"

"Great honey," she turned around and kissed her husband Mark on the lips.

Sandy looked up as the two monoliths made out far above her. Though Julie was a friend of hers, she couldn't help but feel a twinge of envy whenever they did this. Mark was a tall, gorgeous, well-built man with dark ebony skin and silky hair that went down to his shoulders. If they were only the same size... but alas she was just a speck to him and besides she didn't want to get on Julie's bad side. She owed her life to her.

"It smells great. You've worked on this for some time haven't you?"

"Oh yes," Julie smiled. "It just needs a little time to cool down."

"Is that so? Well then," he smirked and leaned in. "Jen's out tonight. How would you like to spend the time while it cools."

Julie giggled and turned on her earpiece. "Sandy. Mark and I have some. matters to attend to. Can you watch the bread for now?"

"Oh sure I guess. Hi mark!"

"She says hi."

Mark leaned down over the tiny speck and smiled. "Good to see you too Sandy."

Sandy felt her knees go weak at that smile, both from the handsomeness of its owner, and from fear as that smile could swallow her whole.

Julie pulled him away to her room where Alicia had spent the last hour trying to pull her way up the carpet fiber when she heard rumbling return.

Suddenly a country wide foot in a country wide sock slammed down just above Alicia. She tried to pull away and found herself caught up in it. She smelled a strong masculine musk permeating the air.

Both Mark and his wife began to undress. He pulled off his sock, which unknown to him had a passenger aboard and tossed it away not noticing where it landed.

Alicia saw a large expansion of black skin surround the fuzzy surface she was trapped on and pull it away. She shut her eyes and grit her teeth as she felt herself and the sock she was attached to go flying towards...
1552211121112.title: Into the carpet

15523.content: Adam is aware that exploring the Lilliputian world is hazardous. There are Micros who regularly converse with the Lillis with their head sets and phones. Just meeting the Lillis is a simple matter of going topside and looking around. But Adam wanted more. He wished to EXPLORE the giant races, to watch them interact and maybe one day witness a Gulliver visiting the Lilliputians.
15523.title: Adam: Extreme adventurer

155231.content:
The closest Microputian tunnel to the surface came up in the back yard of Jess Greenpeace. She knew of the microputians and allowed them to live in her back yard so long as they kept the bugs killed off and flower garden tended. As he made his way to the surface hatch, Maria stopped him. "Where are you going dressed like that?" She asked carrying a basket of flower seeds held close to her chest.

"This is goodbye Marie, I wish you all the best, but if I find what I'm looking for out there... I won't be back," Adam tried to shake her hand goodbye. They'd gone to school together, and never been friends, but now suddenly Maria was acting like she was worried about him. "Where will you go? What if you run out of food?"

"My mind is made up, I'm sick of living like a maggot below the Lilli's feet. It's time I get out there and start living," he was assuring her it was going to be great, even though he had NO assurances of his own. For all he knew, a bird could snatch him up before he left the yard... But that was the thrill of adventure.

"You snould take this... Just in case," Maria took a cheap plastic headset from her purse and thrust it into Adam's hands.
155231.title: Set out on foot

1552311.content:
It's a day's walk in the grass to leave a Lilli's yard. That night he camped beneath the stars in his silk dome tent. In the morning, he filled his twin cantines with the morning dew. By noon the next day he was to a sidewalk and the Lilli watching began in earnest.

Taking a few pictures with his camera he watched the Lilli's drive by in cars so huge that dozens of cities would fit inside them. Fortunately for Adam, the Lilli's kept their pets on leashes or surely he'd be sniffed out and discovered before this adventure even began.

Following the sidewalk but not ON the sidewalk, Adam witnessed the Lillis at their bus stop. Every fifteen minutes a Lilliputian bus would pick some people up and drop others off. He watched one woman put down her hand bag and wait for the bus. It would be SIMPLE to merely hang onto the hand bag and hitch a ride to some far off destination.
1552311.title: He will take the headset

choices: Numerous metal tools: she's a dentist!
Pens and a legal pad: she's a lawyer!
15523111.content: Adam decides to take the risk, and grabs onto the bag right as the woman picks it up. She heads into the bus, pays for her fare, then places the bag under her seat as she sits down. Adam takes this opportunity to sneak inside the bag: safer in there than out here. Unfortunately for our tiny friend, this woman was on her way out of town to meet with a Gulliverian today. He doesn't know this, but he can tell what her occupation is by the contents of her bag!
15523111.title: The journey of a lifetime

155231111.content:
Adam was tossed about in the bag, occasionally landing on large metal picks and pliers. After a couple hours, he heard the booming voice of the woman as she spoke with another female:

"Is Mrs. Weston ready to for her appointment?"

"Yes ma'am, she's in the next room."

You get bounced about a bit more as she walks to an elevator, which opens on a table in a massive room. Of course, you can't see any of these features, or the Gulliverian sitting in a dentist's chair. The woman puts on a headset and speaks into it:

"Hello, Mrs. Weston! Please open wide and keep open. We don't want any accidents, do we?"

"OF COURSE NOT, DR. LET ME KNOW WHAT YOU FIND."

As the dentist reached for her tools she entered the massive mouth of the giantess. You cover your ears from the deafening voice of the second woman in the room. She sounded WAY bigger than the Lilliputian you were stowing away with, maybe she's a Gulliverian? You get so excited you don't notice the large hand enter the bag. It grabs a couple metal tools, with you on top of them! Lifting them up in the air, you finally get a glimpse of the largest mouth you've ever seen in your life. This Gulliverian was as big to the Lilliputian as she was to you! Her enormous mouth could comfortably fit a whole skyscraper inside! Each tooth was as big as a office building! And the tongue could hold two stadiums on top without issue!

You're so busy gawking that you forgot to hang on. You are now flying through the air and land somewhere...
155231111.title: A tough job

1552311112.content: You see that you are plummeting towards the surface of a molar. You land softly in a small crevice, with some plaque breaking your fall. Above you, the Lilli dentist stomps about with a flashlight and a pick. Whenever she sees a patch of plaque, she scrapes it off the tooth. She then brushes the flakes off the tooth and down towards the enormous tongue. That's going to be a problem if she sees your patch. Does she?
1552311112.title: The ivory towers

15523111122.content:
Luckily for Adam, the massive Lilliputian doesn't notice you or the plaque he's on. Unluckily, she seems happy with her work and leaves the mouth. A rumble fills the air as the jaws close, and the light leaves the mouth. In the distance he can just hear the dentist speaking, but it echoes too much for him to understand what she's saying. The Gulliverian deafens Adam as she replies, moving her jaws and tongue about. He remains in the sticky patch of plaque, and doesn't fly about.

More rumbles echo about the mouth as the giantess stands up from the chair and moves around. Adam takes the opportunity to try and peel himself from the plaque. Standing up, he starts to hike towards the front of the mouth, using a flashlight to light the way. As he reaches the premolars, the mouth opens up with a roaring noise. What's going on?
15523111122.title: Still on the tooth

155231111222.content: The world shakes as Adam hears a sharp inhale, then another. A blast of wind flings him in the air, as the deafening roar of a sneeze throws him outside the Gulliverian's mouth. He speeds through the lips, and out into the wide open: 6 miles above the ground! What he didn't know was that the Gulliverian was currently...
155231111222.title: She's sneezing

1552311112222.content: Unfortunately for our nanoscopic adventurer, his unaware chauffeur was currently in the heart of a Brobdingnag city, visiting an old friend at a coffee shop. The Gulliverian was currently sitting at a table on top of an even larger table. While the "small" table was only the size of a city to Adam, the larger one might as well had been a whole country. All around are titanic objects: a mug containing an entire lake of coffee; a sugar shaker that would dwarf any skyscraper; and a titanic bagel on top of a napkin as thick as an office building, and covering a city's area. In the far distance, a hand that seems to exist lays on the table, the only part of the goddess that isn't out of focus. Adam has little time to comprehend all this, as he is currently careening towards the.....
1552311112222.title: Visiting a Brobby!

15523111122221.content:
You scream as you careen towards to unimaginably huge mug of coffee. This is it! This is how you die; melted into boiling liquid!
You skim past the lip of the mug, and plop into the thick sludge.
For a second, you feel tingles all over your body as the adrenaline wears off. And then, you break the surface of the coffee. You're alive! The coffee is luke-warm!
You splash about in confusion as you try to get your bearings.
At first, you don't notice anything out of the ordinary. But something seems off... then you realise, the coffee is shifting! You swivel around. you scream when you see a monstrous mouth coming towards you!
You try to swim away, but it makes no difference as you are dragged back towards to maw.
You are slammed against the upper lip of the Brobby. The mug is pulled away. Here you are, stuck to a giant's lips. You feel a gust of wind, and look up to see an enormous nostril.
15523111122221.title: Mug

15523111122222.content: A cityscape of brown fills Adam's view as he soars towards the bagel. As he does so, the two unaware goddesses talk, their thunderous voices all but deafening the poor guy. A moment later, Adam lands in a crater on the alien surface. The overwhelming smell of bread reminds Adam: he's very hungry. He could grab a bit before jumping off: that wouldn't hurt, right? Meanwhile, the brobby is reaching for a lake of cream cheese, and is planning on spreading it on her breakfast. Is our hero fast enough to grab his own meal?
15523111122222.title: Bagel

choices: ...the twenty something Princess and future Queen.
155231111222221.content:
With some significant difficulty Adam manages to rip off what must be a nano sized piece of bread to its consumer which he holds awkwardly in both hands and with a trying leap leaves the bagel just as what seems to be a city sized tidal wave of cream cheese falls onto the tasty meal. The bread piece almost acts like a stabiliser, focusing his decent as he tumbles down miles towards what he perceives to be the goddess sized Brobby's free hand, resting on the table.

After a few minutes of half free fall, half stable decent, Adam perceives he's arriving at his destination, just past the wrist of the Brobby and onto one of near infinite strands of the jumper she is wearing. With a grateful gasp of relief Adam glances up to see the other hand pick up the bagel and hears the reverberation of its consumption as he also perceives the sounds of conversation from above. At least where he is gives him a measure of security, he thinks as he munches into the bread, aware that the Gullverian he was one previously is now just a somewhat perceivable dot in the distance.

What Adam doesn't know is that the Brobby he has found himself on is actually her country's representative to a significant Prodigian, a being which would make his current host tiny in comparison. This Brobby is also in contact with various diplomats from Gulliver, Lilliputt and even in talks with the Microputians, your own nation, but currently after lunch with her fellow Gulliverian is about to visit the Prodigian, which happens to be...
155231111222221.title: Out of the Bread, Into the Fabric

choices: eye, glancing down at a computer tablet.
ear, with an earpiece embedded alongside
1552311112222212.content:
The Brobdingnagian, a woman named Sarah, finishes her chat with the Gulliverian on the coffee table, and takes her leave. She walks through the town square, over to a skytram. The door closes behind her, and she sits on the blue seats as she rides towards a massive structure in the center of town. The enormous mansion, standing at 50 miles tall, is big even to Sarah, who is used to being at the top. Nervous, she notices a stray group of hairs, and reaches up to fix them in place.

The world shifts, as Adam watches the table float away. His view begins swinging back and forth past the titanic woman, as distant booms echo from the abyss below. Adam quickly gets nauseous, but manages to keep hold of the massive thread he is on. After an agonizing minute of swinging, the brobby sits down again. Vibrations still shake the land underneath him, but nothing like the walking did. Unfortunately, this moment of relief is short-lived. Soon after, Adam's world flips upside down. His view of an endless plain of blue cushions is replaced with a much closer auburn forest of cables, each as wide as a house. The air is filled with the smell of strawberries, a result of the woman's shampoo from that morning. With the sweeping movement of her hand and the sleeve being upside down, Adam finally loses his grip and plummets to the dark forest beneath. He lands near the root of a hair, and takes a moment to catch his breath. Standing up, he watches the hand above him move out of sight, leaving him on the warm head of the massive woman. Sighing to himself, he picks a direction and starts walking.

The tram finishes its journey at a small station on the side of the mansion. As Sarah steps out, she notices the much smaller Gulliverian transits, and can almost make out the even tinier Lilliputian airport. Supposedly this is also where the Microputians arrive, but she'd never be able to see one, even if it was right in front of her! She follows the carefully designated walkway to the entrance. A pair of double doors slide open, and Sarah walks into the only house that could make her feel small. Looking to her left, she sees a properly sized tram, with tracks that follow the walls of the enormous palace about her. She steps inside, and finds a small control panel, with buttons for each room of the mansion. She selects the main office, and takes a seat as the tram follows the spiral staircase up. She pulls out a small computer pad, and reads the latest article in the news.

Adam could tell the woman was walking again: the booms may have been further away, but they were still plenty loud, and still shook him to his core. After a good bit of travel, he finds himself...still in her hair. This woman was bigger than New York: her head could probably house an entire Microputian metropolis. To make matters worse, the ground was covered in a sheen of oil: not enough for her to notice, but enough for Adam to see the puddles and fall down on occasion. A few minutes later, he feels the ground shake again, and the booming stop. He silently rejoiced the newfound silence, until the ground underneath him starts rotating. It's not too long until the floor becomes the wall, and Adam finds himself almost in free fall. Panicking, he reaches for a hair and grabs on. The slick cable slows his fall, but not before he exits the safety of the forest. Now swinging out in the open, he looks to see a monolithic...
1552311112222212.title: ...the thirty something female Prime Minister.

15523111122222121.content:
Adam stares in awe at the orb in front of him. At nearly 6 miles in size, it could house an entire city without her even knowing. It seems to stare right at him, but he knows there's no way she could even see him. Suddenly, the air rumbles as her eyelid slides past. Her eyelashes come within a hundred feet of Adam's hair, and blast him with the world's tiniest gust of wind. Knocked loose, Adam plummets downward.

The tram shudders to a halt, and Sarah stands up. She quickly fixes her suit, and steps outside. All around her sit common office supplies, only she appears to be an inch tall to them. A small marked walkway leads her to a pedestal, where a group of seats awaited her.

Meanwhile, where did her tiny stowaway end up?
15523111122222121.title: The eye of a god

choices: He lands on the Prime Minister's hand.
He falls off, and onto her skirt.
155231111222221212.content:
Adam lands on a hard surface, momentarily blinded by the city-scale screen he was on. Unable to see, he slides down the angled surface, until a monolithic finger crashes into him. As it rises into the air, Adam sticks to the oily surface. He watches as the ground once again flies away from him, and clings to the wrinkle canyon. Booming thunder echoes as the woman talks to someone. The response is from someone so big that the vibrations aren't even audible to Adam, but just bone-rattling vibrations.

Sarah takes a seat and activates her headset.

"Good morning, Prime Minister."

"Ah, Ms. Lasson, good to see you. You're here to discuss the petition to upgrade the buses, correct?"

As their conversation continues, Sarah pulls out the petition and places it in a tube, unwittingly sending a helpless Adam along with it. The document speeds along to printer, where it is scanned and printed to a larger scale. The original document is then returned to the tube, and sent back to Sarah, minus Adam. He was stuck inside the machine during the copying process, landing on a massive sheet of paper. Standing on a vast plain larger than North America, everything beyond was a blur. Well, that is until an equally godlike hand stretches over him and grasps the paper. If he thought the last woman was massive, this one must be bigger than a planet! The paper suddenly rotates, and Adam begins falling...again.
155231111222221212.title: On her hand

choices: Shadows of crumbs.  The PM is eating!
Rumbles.  The PM is standing up!
1552311112222212122.content: Adam lands on a brown, endless plain. He could walk for weeks and still be on this landscape of cloth. Up above, the deafening roar of the Prodigian and Brobdingnagian conversing booms. Adam really doesn't know what to do, at this point any effort would be worthless. With little else to do, he decides to take a nap. A while later, he wakes up to the massive...
1552311112222212122.title: He falls off, and onto her skirt.

choices: He is knocked onto the floor
He is stuck to the hand
15523111122222121221.content: A group of asteroids, each dozens of miles in width, crash down around him. One almost crushes him, only missing by a inch. Well, by a mile to Adam. He recognizes the astronomical object is a bread crumb, one of hundreds that most people make when eating a sandwich. He runs up to it and grabs the tiniest of fractions off of it, enjoying some fresh food while he can. The thunder of conversation was no longer echoing around him; how long did he sleep? Stuck in his hand, he fails to notice the continental hand lower, ready to sweep the crumbs off of the skirt.
15523111122222121221.title: Shadows of crumbs.  The PM is eating!

choices: Luck does come through, he manages to escape
155231111222221212212.content: Poor Adam didn't notice the hand until it was right on top of him. The slightly oily surface acted like glue to the tiny Microputian. Now stuck to a massive pinky finger, Adam is locked in for a carnival ride as the hand returns to the sandwich. The spongy bread absorbs the oil, leaving Adam dry and unstuck...and also falling towards the bread. He lands in a crater big enough to hold his entire city. A crushing noise breaks out behind him, followed by the thunderous noise of a planetary being chewing food. The finger above him shifts, giving him a view of the prime minister, coming in for another bite. This time, the he enters the enormous maw with the sandwich, and then everything goes dark. Adam can barely see the state-sized teeth crush and chew the millions of tons of food. He flails back and forth, from tooth to tongue and back, too small to get crushed by the teeth. However, if his luck doesn't come through he'll get swallowed, and that's a trip he'll never survive.
155231111222221212212.title: He is stuck to the hand

choices: Tries to swing into the ear
15523111122222122.content: Adam's view is filled with an enormous ear. He can't even see the top of bottom, only the mile-high cave that delves deep into the woman's ear. A massive earpiece rests just inside the ear, rising higher than any Microputian structure could hope. As he looks at this, Adam...
15523111122222122.title: The cavernous ear

155231111222221221.content:
Adam began trying to swing the strand of hair he was on, no easy task given the size disparity. But if he could get inside the ear, he might have a shot at making contact with the titaness. It was a long shot but his only hope.

Suddenly the colossus yawned sucking in what was to her a miniscule amount of air but to Adam was practically a typhoon sucking him in. He held on for dear life to avoid being drawn into the vast black hole that was this woman's maw. Fortunately he held on long enough for her to breath out sending his strand of hair spinning around right into the ear.

Letting go, Adam fell a great distance and landed on his feet. The shock of what had just transpired took a little bit to get over but he finally looked up and around at the massive fleshy structure he now found himself in. He also took notice of the giant earpiece which practically covered the entire ear but he was small enough to have swung through.

Needing to get attention before he wound up killed, Adam yelled out at the top of his lungs, "MAAM, CAN WE TALK?"

He waited a moment to determine if the colossal woman had even heard him.
155231111222221221.title: Tries to swing into the ear

choices: She keeps Adam hidden for now
1552311112222212211.content:
Sarah jumped in shock at the voice that popped out of nowhere. It was a small faint thing, but it was still there.

Inside the ear, Adam was shaken from this simple act and fell to the ground of the ear. As he rose to his feet, he suddenly fell back down as a mighty boom shook the world around him.

WHO'S THERE?

Adam eventually got back to his feet from the ringing and the constant swaying as the colossus turned her head looking for the source of the voice. He grabbed the flesh to steady himself and shouted out again.

ADAM. A MICROPUTIAN IN YOUR EAR.

He waited a bit to see if she'd respond.

IN MY EAR?

YES?

WHAT IS A MICROPUTIAN DOING IN MY EAR?

THAT'S A LONG STORY MAAM. I LEFT HOME LOOKING FOR ADVENTURE AND IT FOUND ME.

There was a long pause then as the massive woman thought about how to proceed then.

SOUNDS LIKE YOU HAD A RUN OF BAD LUCK

THAT'S AN UNDERSTATEMENT MAAM.

SARAH. SARAH LASSON.

Another awkward pause followed.

SO MS. LASSON. WHAT DO YOU INTEND TO DO NOW?

I... I DON'T KNOW. I'M USED TO TALKS WITH SMALLER RACES BUT... HWO DID YOU END UP ON ME?

FROM THAT GULLIVERIAN YOU SPOKE TO JUST NOW.

WAIT YOU WERE THERE!?

YES I WOUND UP IN HER MOUTH AND ESCAPED WHILE SHE SPOKE TO YOU.

HER MOUTH!?

Adam again covered his ears from the vibrations.

WELL ADAM, ON BEHALF OF MY FRIEND. I APOLOGIZE. I ASSURE YOU SHE WOULD NEVER HAVE DONE THAT HAD SHE KNOWN.

I'M SURE.

Another pause. The brobdingnagian remembered where she was and what she had to do.

SO LITTLE MAN. I ACTUALLY HAVE A MEETING WITH THE PRODIGIAN PRIME MINISTER OF THIS REGION. IF YOU CAN MAKE IT THROUGH THAT, WE CAN DECIDE WHAT TO DO WITH YOU. WHO KNOWS I MIGHT EVEN INTRODUCE YOU.

Adam was shocked. A real life prodigian? A prime minister of all things? He never imagined he'd get a chance like this. He shouted out his acceptance.

Sarah walked onwards, her mind going back to the miniscule speck in her ear. As a diplomat she had seen microputians in the past but for one to survive a trip inside the mouth of a gulliverian? That was something she'd never heard of.

She walked past the multitude of office supplies to which she appeared an inch tall and followed the marked walkway to a group of seats.

She sat down and waited for the prime minister. She knew the purpose of her visit, but couldn't help wondering if the little microputian deserved an audience as well.
1552311112222212211.title: Disparities

15523111122222122111.content:
Sarah had always been the biggest race until a year ago. Now she knew what a Gulliverian felt like when she stood in the presence of a Prodigian. The Prodigian Prime Minister, Amy, was 37 years old and very pretty. She was tall for a woman of her own size standing at 6"2" with long legs, long blonde hair down to her shoulder blades and a generous bust that fit her body perfectly. As far and Sarah knew, she was unmarried and had offered to show Sarah her body in the past. She at least took no for an answer and there would have been nothing Sarah could have done to stop Amy. Sarah was partial to women and Amy was the top of the food chain. She thought she would not be able to say no if another offer presented itself.

Sarah was called into Amy's office and followed the marked path. There was an elevator in Amy's desk for any race to use to get to the top, but when Amy dealt with Brobdingnagians or Gulliverians, it was just easier to pluck them from the floor and put them on her desk. Her assistant had placed a desk that was about an inch tall on her desk for Sarah to sit at.

Sarah felt pressure around her waist as Amy grabbed her from the floor. Amy brought her up to eye level to examine Sarah and liked what she saw. She gave her ass and little rub when she put Sarah down on her desk. Amy thought Sarah was very pretty and was going to play with her. She wasn't going to take no as for an answer this time.

Sarah said that before we get down to business, I want to let you know that a Microputian named Adam went looking for an adventure and ended up in my ear, unbeknownst to me until a few minutes ago. I know what we are talking about is sensitive, so I think it would be best if we removed him from my ear canal before proceeding. Neither Amy or Sarah would be charged if Adam died during the extraction or any future interaction between the three of them as violated Sarah's space and had trespassed into Amy's office.

Fortunately for Adam, Amy, as Prime Minister, had the necessary tools to extract Adam from Sarah's ear. Sarah put Adam on her hand which stretched for miles. He looked around at his surroundings and saw everyday objects tens of thousands of miles large. He thought Sarah was huge, but Amy was larger than a continents when compared to him. He could see her breasts in the distance above him standing proudly out from her chest for a thousands of miles. Her nipples were as big as Sarah.

Sarah put ten thousand ear pieces on her hand near Adam for him to put on one so he could communicate with Amy and Sarah. Sarah and Amy both had an eye piece on that allowed them to see Adam as if he were a few inches tall.

Amy asked Adam if he had ever seen another race before this adventure. He said that he had see some Lilliputians, but not other bigger race. He said he was in awe of Amy's size and couldn't believe anyone could be that big. Amy said she couldn't believe anyone could be as small as him so they both had to readjust their beliefs. Amy asked Adam if he would like to be placed on her hand. Adam said yes as he always loved taller women and Amy took the crown. Sarah gently placed Adam on Amy's hand.

Adam could feel her heart beat and the warmth coming off her hand. He saw her index finger in the distance and realized that she could crush Microputian states with just her finger. He wondered how his race, or for that matter, any race, fight the Prodigian if they decided to fight. Amy asked Adam if he liked women and he said he did. Amy asked if he liked taller races and Adam said he did (although, what was he supposed to say if he did not). She then handed Adam back to Sarah and took off her blouse and was standing in front of Sarah and Adam with a short black skirt and black bra.

Adam, you probably won't have the opportunity again, but would you like to see and play on my titanic breasts?
15523111122222122111.title: She Shows Adam

choices: He manages to survive in the stomach long enough to escape
155231111222222.content:
Little Adam unfortunately did not make it. Before he got anywhere near the edge, he felt himself caught up in a white sticky tsunami. Fortunately he found himself somehow end up on the top with his face stuck upwards but his body stuck in the ocean of cream cheese. He tried to move. Tried to break free, but to no avail. He was too small. Too helpless.

He felt a sudden lurch as the Brobdingnagian lifted the crater of bread up towards her face far above. She didn't even look down as her mouth opened and took a bite.

Adam gaped in awe at the cavern he now found himself in. No. Cavern didn't really cut it. It could have been the center of the Earth in terms of size and heat. The top of the mouth looked over a mile above and the teeth were the size of cities.

Adam paled at the sight. This was not how he had intended his journey to go.

"Not like this," he started to weep, overwhelmed. "Not like this. I just wanted to see the world."

He was interrupted by the tilting of the maw around him as the giantess tilted her head back and sent the food towards the abyss at the back.

"No," he said softly, aware of his own powerlessness. He took one look back at the opening to the mouth at what might be his last glimpse of light.

The giant woman gulped and sent him down towards his fate.

What would that fate be.
155231111222222.title: No

info.brief_description: Various stories taking place in the Lilliput, Gulliver, and Brobdingnag universe.
info.description:
This interactive story takes place in the Lilliput / Gulliver / Brobdingnag universe* where three civilizations with drastic size differences live side by side. Each civilization appears to be one inch tall in comparison to the above tier. (Size chart below). The three civilizations attempt to live in cohesion and have laws in-place that recognizes all three races of people as equalsâthough this is easier said than done.

In this universe, the Lilliputian population hovers around 5 trillion; Gulliverians around 1 billion, and only 1 million Brobdingnagians. The Lilliputians are the brightest and most technologically advanced race. The Gulliverians are primarily interested in making friends, building strong families, and being the bridge between Brobdingnagians and Lilliputians. The Brobdingnagians tend to be wealthy and live lazy lives; due to their size, they could get a lot of physical work done with relative ease.

Human trafficking exists in this universe but is strictly illegal. An underground black market feeds the needs of a few who love to torment the smaller ones. Dating and marriages between races exist. Conservative individuals detest inter-race marriages whilst liberals encourage inter-race relationships. It is common to see relationships one step up or one step downâit is not common to see Lilly and Brobby relationships because the size difference is too great. Communication exists through the use of headsets. The little ones can hear the big ones, but not vice versaâbe sure they are using a headset or some other means of communication.

Brobdingnag POV:
A Gulliverian looks to be one inch tall (25.4mm)
A Lilliputian looks to be .35mm tall

Gulliverian POV:
A Brobdingnagian appears to be 432 feet tall (132 meters)
A Lilliputian appears to be 1 inch tall (25.4mm)

Lilliputian POV:
A Brobdingnagian appears to be 5.9 miles tall (9.5 km)
A Gulliverian appears to be 432 feet tall (132 meters)

Visual graphic of this universe: http://i.imgur.com/f3rPwVG.jpg

Themes:
-Pretty much anything goes. From dark & cruel to gentle & caring--from violence to benevolence--and everything in between.
-Vore, crush, body exploration, sex, love, consensual, non-consensual, adventure, smut, plot, giant, giantess, etc..
-There's pretty much something for everybody.

Story Rules**:
-Only humans from one of the three races listed above are permitted.
-I prefer straight content, but homosexual content is okay only if it is properly tagged before each branch/choice.
-No restrictions on the age of characters. Just don't be weird and make it an issue.
-I reserve the right to remove anything that doesn't follow canon (I'm lenient, but do attempt to stick to the universe).


*If you want a better idea on how this universe works, check out A Wedding Story and Cities in the Cellar by Minuss OR Carnival Nights, Lilly Tours, and Brobdingnag Holidays by Kosmita at giantessworld.net.

Follow me on DeviantArt: kosm1ta.deviantart.com
Follow me on Twitter: @_Kosmita

**This is my first time doing an interactive story. I may add more rules as we go along (most likely not). I donât want to restrict any creativity or contributions, so Iâm keeping the rules pretty loose. Please, please contribute!
